entry.key: How can the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> be older than the universe itself?
entry.value: <color=lightblue>眼</color>怎会比宇宙本身更古老呢？

entry.key: Suppose it is a relic from a previous universe.
entry.value: 也许它是上个宇宙的遗物。

entry.key: The early universe was unimaginably hot and dense. If anything existed before, it would have been destroyed.
entry.value: 早期的宇宙极度致密且高温。任何在那以前存在过的东西，也都应已不复存在。

entry.key: Suppose the universe is older than previously assumed.
entry.value: 也许宇宙比过去所设想的更加古老。

entry.key: The <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color> requires a powerful, highly advanced warp core. How should we obtain it?
entry.value: 我们该如何获得<color=orange>灰烬星工程</color>所需的一颗更强力且更高级的跃迁核心？

entry.key: Solution 2: We could craft a new advanced warp core inspired by the <color=orange>Vessel</color>’s warp core.
entry.value: 方案2：我们可以基于<color=orange>母舰</color>的跃迁核心的设计重新制造一颗高级跃迁核心。

entry.key: OENO: The greatest challenge here, I think, is we don’t have the design for such a powerful core, or any of the original crafters of the <color=orange>Vessel</color>’s core.
entry.value: OENO: 我认为，目前最大的困难是没有这种强力核心的设计图；我们当中也没有任何一个人是<color=orange>母舰</color>核心的原设计者。

entry.key: CLARY: No, but Poke was apprenticed to Annona, who created the original design, and our <color=orange>Black Hole Forge</color> is adept at crafting simpler cores.
entry.value: CLARY: 的确如此，但Poke曾是Annona的学徒。而Annona就是母舰核心的原设计者。我们的<color=orange>黑洞锻造室</color>也能熟练地制造简单的跃迁核心。

entry.key: POKE: I believe I can be of use here! The <color=orange>Vessel</color>’s warp core was created before my time, but Annona explained many of his designs to me.
entry.value: POKE: 我想我能为这事出一份力！虽然<color=orange>母舰</color>核心的设计是发生在我出生前的事，但Annona曾向我讲解过许多他的设计思路。

entry.key: IDAEA: This is the safest path for our clan.
entry.value: IDAEA: 这对我们家族而言是最安全的方案。

entry.key: AVENS: Is the safest path the best one? Our goal is worth the risk.
entry.value: AVENS: 最安全的方案就是最好的吗？这个目标值得我们去冒险。

entry.key: CASSAVA: Is it, though? We’ve tried for so long to find something that I (and others) now believe might be impossible to find. If the search for the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> is a futile one, we should choose the option with the least potential for harm.
entry.value: CASSAVA: 这真的值得冒险吗？我们已经花费了太多时间去寻找一个我（和一些人）都已相信不可能找到的东西。如果寻找<color=lightblue>眼</color>的任务只是徒劳一场，我们就应当选择潜在损失最小的方案。

entry.key: SPIRE: Abandoning the <color=orange>Vessel</color>’s warp core and its casing means losing valuable knowledge.
entry.value: SPIRE: 放弃<color=orange>母舰</color>的跃迁核心及其外壳意味着宝贵知识的遗失。

entry.key: MITIS: This is true; however, it’s knowledge we have little hope of recovering. It would be best to relearn, I think.
entry.value: MITIS: 的确如此; 但要找回这些知识希望渺茫。我想我们最好是重新学习它们。

entry.key: POKE: I would very much like to craft such a powerful core! More relevantly, I believe the <color=orange>Black Hole Forge</color> crew and I could recreate the basic design.
entry.value: POKE: 我很想要制作出这种强力的核心！更重要的是<color=orange>黑洞锻造室</color>人员和我有信心能够还原出一个基础设计。

entry.key: CASSAVA: I imagine I’ve been hard on Poke, again. This in turn means I’ve made things difficult for her sister (Clary).
entry.value: CASSAVA: 我想我又对Poke太过苛刻了。这也意味着我又让她的姐姐（Clary）为难了。

entry.key: CASSAVA: If Poke and I are oil and water, Clary is our emulsifier. She certainly makes us a better team than would mixing through shaking (although sometimes I would like to shake Poke!).
entry.value: CASSAVA: 如果我与Poke像是油水不溶，Clary就是我们之间的乳化剂。 比起为了互溶而猛烈地摇晃，她的确帮助了我们更好地合作共事 。(但我有时真的很想把Poke狠狠地摇一顿！).

entry.key: CASSAVA: Jokes aside, suppose my own fear of never finding the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> prompted my argument with Poke. That would be immature of me.
entry.value: CASSAVA: 玩笑归玩笑，我想是自己对永远无法找到<color=lightblue>眼</color>的担忧导致了我和Poke的争执。那样做就是我的不成熟。

entry.key: CASSAVA: I should apologize... At least to Clary, who could then tell Poke.
entry.value: CASSAVA: 我应该道歉... 至少向Clary道歉，再由她告诉Poke。

entry.key: POKE: I feel strange, trying to recreate Annona’s warp core without him. At times, it still feels strange to no longer be his (very young) apprentice, and for the <color=orange>Black Hole Forge</color> to be in my care and not his.
entry.value: POKE: 在没有Annona的情况下尝试复原他的跃迁核心让我有种奇怪的感受。有时，想到自己不再是他（非常年轻）的学徒，<color=orange>黑洞锻造室</color>也已由我管理而不是他时，我还是会感觉到奇怪。

entry.key: POKE: Hypothesis: This will always feel strange. Even though my time with him was short, I miss my old mentor, and deeply.
entry.value: POKE: 假设：这将总会使我感到奇怪。尽管做他学徒的时间不长，我还是深深的怀念着我从前的导师。

entry.key: POKE: To have the chance to try is thrilling, but... I don’t want to disappoint everyone. I think I can do this (probably), but what if excitement has clouded my assessment of my own abilities?
entry.value: POKE: 得到这个尝试的机会令我振奋不已，但...我不想让大家感到失望。我觉得我能够做到（也许吧），但万一是我激动的情绪导致我错误的估计了自己的能力呢？

entry.key: POKE: Was I wrong in volunteering to build it...? I was born in this star system, and never saw Annona’s warp core with my own three eyes. I only know what he taught me. What if I’ve bitten off a larger portion than I can consume?
entry.value: POKE: 我是不是不应该主动接下制造核心的任务...？我出生在这个太阳系，而我的三只眼睛从未见过Annona的跃迁核心。我仅仅知道他所教给我的知识。万一这件任务的困难程度远超我的能力所及呢？

entry.key: POKE: Still, all I can give is my best. And as Annona would say, should my best prove insufficient, then we will find another way to achieve what’s needed. I have Clary and Root in the forge, and I have my clan. I am not alone!
entry.value: POKE: 尽管如此，我所能做的只有尽己所能。正如Annona说的那样，如果事实证明我的能力还不够，那么我将另辟蹊径实现所需的目标。我有在锻造所的Clary和Root，我还有我的家族。我并不孤单！

entry.key: SOLANUM: Formation Of This Universe
entry.value: SOLANUM: 宇宙的形成

entry.key: SOLANUM: No one knows how this universe was made, but one thing we do know is everything used to be very hot and very dense (tightly packed together).
entry.value: SOLANUM: 没人知道宇宙是如何诞生的，但我们所知的是在过去整个宇宙都非常高温且致密(紧密的压缩在一起)。

entry.key: SOLANUM: As this early universe expanded, it also cooled down. Once it had cooled down enough, particles were able to group together to form things like galaxies, stars, and planets!
entry.value: SOLANUM: 随着早期的宇宙逐渐膨胀，它也逐渐冷却。当其冷却到一定程度后，粒子便能够组合在一起并形成了星系，恒星和行星！

entry.key: SOLANUM: Since then, space has continued to expand at a faster and faster rate, which is hard to think about for too long without your brain hurting.
entry.value: SOLANUM: 自从那时，宇宙便不停地以越来越快的速度膨胀，这可真是让人越思考越头疼。

entry.key: SOLANUM: This universe will keep getting colder and larger, until one day, the stars and the life they support will all die.
entry.value: SOLANUM: 这个宇宙将不断地变得越大越冷，直到有一天，所有的恒星和它们孕育的生命都将死亡。

entry.key: SOLANUM: That’s scary to think about, even though Conoy tells me it won’t happen in our lifetimes. But it’ll happen in someone else’s, someday!
entry.value: SOLANUM: 想想看真是可怕，尽管Conoy告诉我这不会在我们的有生之年里发生，但在未来这将会发生在其他的某个人身上！

entry.key: LAMI: Explanation of Festivals
entry.value: LAMI: 发现节的介绍

entry.key: LAMI: All the Nomai clans from all over the universe meet in one place to share what they’ve learned in science and art. It’s called the festival!
entry.value: LAMI: 宇宙各地的Nomai家族齐聚一地，分享他们所学到的关于科学与艺术的知识。这就是发现节！

entry.key: FILIX: Don’t forget, festivals happen every ten years!
entry.value: FILIX: 别忘了，发现节每十年举行一次！

entry.key: LAMI: We can’t go because we’re stuck here. But Filix says we used to go, too.
entry.value: LAMI: 我们被困在这儿了所以参加不了。但Filix说我们以前也会去参加。

entry.key: LAMI: At some festivals, one clan’s big discovery can mean all the Nomai get to advance, too. Like Annona’s warp core, which made it so everyone can warp long distances and explore more.
entry.value: LAMI: 在发现节里，有时一个家族的重大发现意味着整个Nomai种族的进步。比如Annona的跃迁核心让大家都能进行长距离跃迁并探索更多的地点。

entry.key: LAMI: Each clan has a festival envoy to show their most interesting work. (Our envoy was Thatch!)
entry.value: LAMI: 每个家族都有一位节日代表来展示他们最有趣的探索成果。（我们的代表是Thatch!）

entry.key: LAMI: A single festival could last a long, long time!
entry.value: LAMI: 一次发现节可能持续很久很久！

entry.key: PLUME: Use caution! A black hole sleeps below. You must not slip.
entry.value: PLUME: 当心！下方沉睡着一个黑洞。千万不要滑倒了！

entry.key: Emergency escape hatch
entry.value: 紧急逃生舱门

entry.key: BEGIN FLIGHTLOG: <color=orange>Escape Pod 1</color>. <color=orange>Vessel</color> has been mortally injured. Emergency sequence activated. Awaiting departure from <color=orange>Vessel</color>.
entry.value: 开始航行日志：<color=orange>1号逃生舱</color>。 <color=orange>母舰</color>受到致命伤害。启动紧急程序。等待从<color=orange>母舰</color>撤离。

entry.key: Launching <color=orange>Escape Pod 3</color>... Launching <color=orange>Escape Pod 2</color>... Now launching <color=orange>Escape Pod 1</color>.
entry.value: 发射<color=orange>3号逃生舱</color>... 发射<color=orange>2号逃生舱</color>... 现在发射<color=orange>1号逃生舱</color>。

entry.key: ALERT. Collision imminent. Preparing for impact.
entry.value: 警报！即将发生碰撞。请做好防护准备。

entry.key: Scanning external environment... Scan complete. Minor structural instabilities detected. Pockets of breathable air detected. Adequate solar energy detected. Verdict: HOSPITABLE.
entry.value: 扫描外部环境...扫描完成。检测到轻微的地质结构不稳定。检测到有可呼吸空气的区域。检测到适度的太阳能量。 结论: 宜居。

entry.key: CONOY: Cassava’s <color=orange>Construction Yard</color> has been using the cyclones on <color=lightblue>Giant’s Deep</color> to lift <color=orange>Orbital Probe Cannon</color> parts into orbit, but one component was pushed down past the current that usually prevents anything from sinking.
entry.value: CONOY: 一直以来，Cassava的<color=orange>建造场</color>都在利用<color=lightblue>深巨星</color>上的气旋将<color=orange>轨道探测砲</color>的组件送入轨道，但有一个组件却沉入了通常阻止任何东西下沉的洋流下面。

entry.key: CONOY: Spire and I are crafting a model to determine why this happened.
entry.value: CONOY: Spire和我正在建造一个模型来确定这种现象的成因。

entry.key: SPIRE: An update: It’s now clear there are two different types of cyclone.
entry.value: SPIRE: 更新：我们已确认存在有两种不同类型的气旋。

entry.key: SPIRE: Most cyclones on <color=lightblue>Giant’s Deep</color> rotate clockwise. These are the cyclones Cassava typically uses to send components into orbit.
entry.value: SPIRE: <color=lightblue>深巨星</color>上的大多数气旋都是顺时针旋转的。这些正是Cassava用来将组件送入轨道的气旋。

entry.key: SPIRE: There also exists a rarer type of cyclone that spins the opposite direction and pushes objects beneath the waters and below the current.
entry.value: SPIRE: 但也存在一种更罕见的反向旋转且能将物体推到水中并沉入洋流下方的气旋。

entry.key: CASSAVA: My gratitude, Spire. Conoy is showing me your handiwork, and I’m intrigued by this secondary type of cyclone. But was it really necessary to build a model to tell me that?
entry.value: CASSAVA: 感谢你，Spire。 Conoy向我展示了你的作品，我也对这第二种气旋很感兴趣。但真的有必要建造一个模型来向我解释它吗？

entry.key: SPIRE: The model will be useful as we continue monitoring <color=lightblue>Giant’s Deep</color>.
entry.value: SPIRE: 这个模型对我们继续监测<color=lightblue>深巨星</color>会有用处。

entry.key: SPIRE: Also I very much wanted to make a model.
entry.value: SPIRE: 而且我就是很想做一个模型。

entry.key: ILEX: Look out, look out below!
entry.value: ILEX: 当心，当心脚下！

entry.key: ILEX: Look out for the gravity hole!
entry.value: ILEX: 当心引力洞！

entry.key: ILEX: For should you slip
entry.value: ILEX: 你若滑倒

entry.key: ILEX: And lose your grip,
entry.value: ILEX: 又没抓牢，

entry.key: ILEX: Then into space you’ll go!
entry.value: ILEX: 就要进入太空咯！

entry.key: PLUME: Of note: Be sure not to wander far from here. Though this area is somewhat unstable, it’s safer than any we’ve found so far.
entry.value: PLUME: 注意：请不要离开太远。这片区域虽有些不稳定，但比我们目前所找到的任何地方都要安全。

entry.key: PLUME: The temporary settlement is finished, but remember to be cautious of falling rocks and dust created by meteor impacts.
entry.value: PLUME: 临时安置点已经建设完成，但要小心陨石撞击造成的落石与扬尘。

entry.key: THATCH: I can’t understand. Why did the <color=orange>Vessel</color> crash in that place?
entry.value: THATCH: 我想不明白。为什么<color=orange>母舰</color>会在那个地方坠毁？

entry.key: PLUME: Was the <color=orange>Vessel</color> unwell in some way?
entry.value: PLUME: 是<color=orange>母舰</color>哪里的状态不好吗？

entry.key: FILIX: No, Annona and I checked before the warp, and the warp core and navigation systems were both well.
entry.value: FILIX: 不，Annona和我在跃迁前进行过检查，跃迁核心和导航系统都状态正常。

entry.key: FILIX: We warped to follow that curious signal from the <color=lightblue>Eye of the universe</color>. Where we arrived was wrong; it wasn’t where we tried to go.
entry.value: FILIX: 我们跟随那个来自<color=lightblue>宇宙之眼</color>的独特信号进行了跃迁。但我们的目的地出了差错；那并不是我们要去的地方。

entry.key: THATCH: Suppose it wasn’t a problem with the <color=orange>Vessel</color>, but with our destination.
entry.value: THATCH: 或许这并不是<color=orange>母舰</color>的问题，而是我们的目的地的问题。

entry.key: FILIX: I’m afraid for our friends in <color=orange>Escape Pod 3</color>....
entry.value: FILIX: 我担心我们在<color=orange>3号逃生舱</color>里的朋友们...

entry.key: BELLS: If you’re here to make your first pilgrimage to the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>, you are almost prepared to set out on this deeply significant journey. Before you do, pause, and remember your history.
entry.value: BELLS: 如果你来到这里是为了前往<color=lightblue>量子卫星</color>进行你的第一次量子朝圣，你已即将做好准备踏上这场意义非凡的旅途。但临行前请你稍作停留，回想我们的过去。

entry.key: BELLS: We make this journey not only for ourselves, but also to honor the members of our clan who came before us: those who, after the crash that brought them to this star system, became stranded on <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color> and on <color=lightblue>Ember Twin</color>, with no communication between these two groups of survivors.
entry.value: BELLS: 踏上这场旅途不仅仅是为我们自己，也是为了铭记我们的前人。他们在母舰坠毁后来到这个太阳系，被分别困在了<color=lightblue>碎空星</color>和<color=lightblue>余烬星</color>，并失去了彼此间的联系。

entry.key: BELLS: These Nomai looked upward from two different planets and saw the same wandering moon visiting their skies. It was this moon (the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>) that kept their curiosity alive during this long period of hardship.
entry.value: BELLS: 这些Nomai人在各自所困的行星上仰望天空，发现了同一颗游荡卫星。正是这颗卫星(the <color=lightblue>量子卫星</color>)让他们的好奇心没有在这段艰难的时期里被磨灭。

entry.key: BELLS: After the two divided groups were able to reunite, it became our clan’s united goal to find and visit the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>. This took time, and many Nomai who dreamed of seeing the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> died before we discovered how to make the journey.
entry.value: BELLS: 在两个团体重聚后，找寻并登上<color=lightblue>量子卫星</color>成为了我们家族的共同目标。这一过程十分漫长，许多梦想着亲眼看到<color=lightblue>量子卫星</color>的Nomai人在我们学会如何完成这一旅途的方法前就逝去了。

entry.key: BELLS: When you reach the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>, recall these Nomai, and carry their curiosity onward with you.
entry.value: BELLS: 当你到达<color=lightblue>量子卫星</color>后，请回想这些Nomai人，并带着他们的好奇心继续前进。

entry.key: PLUME: The trees are moving! The trees in this grove wander about freely (the entire plant, roots and all)! This is not normal, even for this alien planet. And I never see them move! Is that even possible?!
entry.value: PLUME: 树在移动！这个树林里的树会自己随意移动（整个树木，包括根部）! 即使对这种外星植物而言，这也一定不正常。并且我从未看到它们移动过！这怎么可能？！

entry.key: PLUME: If anyone else witnesses this disturbing behavior, I implore you, record your observations here. Either these trees are aberrant, or my brain must be!
entry.value: PLUME: 如果有人注意到这种树令人不安的行为，我恳请你在此记录下你的观察。如果不是这些树有问题，那一定就是我的脑子出了问题！

entry.key: THATCH: Plume is right; the trees do move! I confess I didn’t notice until I read his notes.
entry.value: THATCH: Plume没错；这些树确实会动！我承认自己在读了他的记录前从未注意到过。

entry.key: THATCH: Alarmingly, it isn’t only the trees: There is other matter in this area (such as that unusual shard of rock) moving in this same eerie way.
entry.value: THATCH: 令人惊奇的是，不只是树木：这片地区还有其他东西（比如那块不寻常的岩石碎片）会像这样诡异地移动。

entry.key: FILIX: That rock is unusual for another reason, too, Thatch: It possesses color and texture I’ve never seen elsewhere on this planet!
entry.value: FILIX: Tatch，那块岩石还有一点不寻常：它的色彩和纹理是我从未在这颗行星的任何地方见到过的。

entry.key: FILIX: Hypothesis: This rock shard’s presence is significant. We should study it! (Could it be what is causing other nearby objects to also move about this area?)
entry.value: FILIX: 假设：这块岩石碎片的存在非常重要。我们应该研究它！(会不会是它导致了附近的物体也在这片地区移动呢？)

entry.key: THATCH: Plume, Filix, and I have determined this atypical shard of rock is the reason objects in this grove are behaving in a quantum manner.
entry.value: THATCH: Plume、Filix和我证实了这块独特的岩石碎片正是导致这片树林中的物体表现出量子特性的原因。

entry.key: THATCH: The only other object we’ve observed displaying this quantum behavior is the <color=lightblue>wandering moon</color>. I imagine the moon’s behavior and this grove’s are related.
entry.value: THATCH: 目前我们所观察过表现出量子特性的其他物体仅有<color=lightblue>漂泊卫星</color>。我设想该卫星的行为与这片树林中的现象有所联系。

entry.key: PLUME: In her note from earlier, Filix mentions this strange type of rock isn’t found elsewhere on <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color>. What if it isn’t originally from this planet?
entry.value: PLUME: 在先前的笔记中，Filix提到在<color=lightblue>碎空星</color>的其他地方没有出现过这种奇怪的岩石。是否可能这种岩石并非源自这颗行星？

entry.key: PLUME: Hypothesis: This “quantum shard” is from the <color=lightblue>wandering (quantum) moon</color>. Perhaps it is even a small piece of the moon itself.
entry.value: PLUME: 假设：这块“量子碎片”来自<color=lightblue>漂泊（量子）卫星</color>。它甚至有可能就是卫星的一小块碎片。

entry.key: FILIX: Of note: A unique signal is coming from this shard! Curiously, our friend the <color=lightblue>wandering moon</color> sounds the same.
entry.value: FILIX: 值得注意的是：这块碎片正发出一种独特的信号！有趣的是，它听上去与来自我们的朋友<color=lightblue>漂泊卫星</color>的信号一模一样。

entry.key: FILIX: I’ve also heard the same signal this shard produces calling out from <color=lightblue>Giant’s Deep</color>,<color=lightblue>Timber Hearth</color>, and the <color=lightblue>Hourglass Twins</color>. Suppose there are other shards like this one!
entry.value: FILIX: 我还听到<color=lightblue>深巨星</color>、<color=lightblue>木炉星</color>和<color=lightblue>沙漏双星</color>都传来了与这块岩石相同的信号。或许这些行星上也有这样的岩石碎片！

entry.key: BELLS: Welcome, Solanum! Your arrival here means you’ve completed your preparations on <color=lightblue>Giant’s Deep</color> and are ready to depart for the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>.
entry.value: BELLS: Solanum，欢迎你的到来！到达此处意味着你已完成了在<color=lightblue>深巨星</color>上的准备，可以前往<color=lightblue>量子卫星</color>了。

entry.key: BELLS: On your pilgrimage, the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> will carry you, just as it carried me and many in our clan before me, to the moon’s sixth and most secret location.
entry.value: BELLS: 在你的朝圣旅途中，<color=lightblue>量子卫星</color>将会带着你，正如它带着我和我们家族的前人们那样，前往它最神秘的第六个位置。

entry.key: BELLS: You’ll be aided in your pilgrimage by the shrine our clan built on the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>. But remember this final rule: To explore the sixth location, the shrine must be on the moon’s north pole.
entry.value: BELLS: 我们家族在<color=lightblue>量子卫星</color>上建造的圣堂将会在旅途中为你提供指引。但记住这一最后法则：要探索第六个位置，圣堂必须位于卫星的北极点。

entry.key: BELLS: Be curious on your journey!
entry.value: BELLS: 希望你在旅途中保持好奇心！

entry.key: BELLS: Be welcomed in this place! Above you stands the <color=orange>Tower of Quantum Knowledge</color>.
entry.value: BELLS: 欢迎来到此地！你的上方矗立着<color=orange>量子知识之塔</color>。

entry.key: BELLS: If you are making your first pilgrimage to the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>, ascend these stairs, and obtain the last of the knowledge you need for your journey.
entry.value: BELLS: 如果你将前往<color=lightblue>量子卫星</color>进行你的第一次量子朝圣，请登上阶梯，学习你的旅程所需的最后一个知识。

entry.key: BELLS: Beneath your feet lies the <color=orange>Tower of Quantum Knowledge</color>.
entry.value: BELLS: 在你脚下的是<color=orange>量子知识之塔</color>。

entry.key: BELLS: If you are preparing to make your first pilgrimage to the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>, descend the steps to the entrance below. The knowledge held within will help you on your journey.
entry.value: BELLS: 如果你准备前往<color=lightblue>量子卫星</color>进行你的第一次量子朝圣，请走下楼梯前往下方的入口。塔中的知识将在你的旅途中提供帮助。

entry.key: Activate the <color=orange>gravity cannon</color>
entry.value: 启动<color=orange>重力砲</color>

entry.key: Call the <color=orange>shuttle</color> home
entry.value: 召回<color=orange>穿梭机</color>

entry.key: LAEVI: We’re meeting in the <color=orange>Fossil Fish Cave</color> to play the game! If you’re too big to climb through the <color=orange>Anglerfish Overlook</color> hole:
entry.value: LAEVI: 我们要到<color=orange>鱼化石洞穴</color>去玩游戏！如果你个子太大，钻不过<color=orange>鮟鱇鱼望台</color>的洞，

entry.key: LAEVI: You’ll have to go the long way, but it isn’t far. Go to <color=orange>Stepping Stone Cave</color>, and then up and into the <color=orange>Fossil Fish Cave</color>.
entry.value: LAEVI: 那你就得绕路了，但不算太远。先去<color=orange>踏脚石洞穴</color>，然后再往上爬进入<color=orange>鱼化石洞穴</color>。

entry.key: TAGET: I tried to get to the fossil fish through <color=orange>Stepping Stone Cave</color>, but I couldn’t find the entrance. Where is it?
entry.value: TAGET: 我试着从<color=orange>踏脚石洞穴</color>去到鱼化石，但我找不到入口。是在哪儿呢？

entry.key: ILEX: Remember to feed the fossil fish first! If you go to the <color=orange>Anglerfish Overlook</color> and throw a light into his mouth, he’ll show you the way.
entry.value: ILEX: 记着先给鱼儿喂吃的！去<color=orange>鮟鱇鱼望台</color>向它嘴里丢一个灯，它就会给你指路的。

entry.key: LAMI: Taget can’t fit through the <color=orange>Anglerfish Overlook</color> hole anymore because he grew bigger! He’s taller than Laevi now.
entry.value: LAMI: Taget已经钻不过<color=orange>鮟鱇鱼望台</color>的洞，因为他个子长大了! 他现在比Laevi还高。

entry.key: LAEVI: Who cares? Ilex is still tallest.
entry.value: LAEVI: 这有啥呢？Ilex不还是最高的。

entry.key: TAGET: Are we playing the fossil fish game tonight?
entry.value: TAGET: 今天晚上玩化石鱼游戏吗？

entry.key: SOLANUM: I fed the fossil fish a new lantern. If you go to <color=orange>Stepping Stone Cave</color>, the entrance to the <color=orange>Fossil Fish Cave</color> is easy to see now.
entry.value: SOLANUM: 我给化石鱼喂了一个新的灯。这样方便你们能更容易看到<color=orange>踏脚石洞穴</color>进入<color=orange>鱼化石洞穴</color>的入口了。

entry.key: LAEVI: Gratitude, Solanum! It’s good you’re small enough to climb in through the hole at the <color=orange>Anglerfish Overlook</color>.
entry.value: LAEVI: 感谢你，Solanum！真羡慕你个子够小能钻过<color=orange>鮟鱇鱼望台</color>的洞。

entry.key: LAMI: I’m still small enough!
entry.value: LAMI: 我个子也还够小呢！

entry.key: LAEVI: You won’t be for long. Mom and Dad are tall, so you and I will be tall, too.
entry.value: LAEVI: 你也快了。爸爸、妈妈都很高，所以我们俩也会长得很高的。

entry.key: MELORAE: The heat from this star system’s <color=lightblue>sun</color> is more bearable below the surface.
entry.value: MELORAE: 这颗行星的地表下的温度还算可以忍受。

entry.key: MELORAE: When our escape pod punctured this planet’s surface, it broke into what scans show is a cave system with much cooler air. I would recommend we seek a site down there to build a long-term shelter, Annona, but these passages are a maze!
entry.value: MELORAE: 扫描显示我们的逃生舱撞入了地表下的一个洞穴系统，里面的空气更凉爽。Annona，我很想提议在下方寻找一处地点建立长期庇护所，但这些洞道真是错综复杂！

entry.key: ANNONA: Even with this danger, they are still our best chance for survival. We’ll form teams and descend into the caves to look for a shelter site. We can mark our findings on the walls to avoid becoming irreversibly lost.
entry.value: ANNONA: 虽然存在危险性，但这是我们生存下来的最佳机会。我们分成小队进入这些洞穴寻找庇护所的建设点。要把发现记录在岩壁上避免迷失方向。

entry.key: ANNONA: Be cautious, everyone.
entry.value: ANNONA: 各位一定要小心。

entry.key: RHUS: And be aware of the sand as you search. It appears to be rising gradually.
entry.value: RHUS: 找寻时也要注意沙子。它似乎正在逐渐上涨。

entry.key: COLEUS: The path to the shelter site is somewhat convoluted, so follow the instructions ahead closely!
entry.value: COLEUS: 通往庇护所地点的道路有些复杂，请紧跟前方的指示！

entry.key: COLEUS: To reach the shelter site, walk forward until you meet the sandfall at the pit, then turn left. Continue to the room filled with rock column formations and climb upward through the opening above them.
entry.value: COLEUS: 从此处往前走，走到有流沙瀑布的坑洞边，随后往左走。走到一个充满岩柱构造的洞室后，从顶部的开口向上爬。

entry.key: COLEUS: The sand here is rising, so you must be cautious but swift.
entry.value: COLEUS: 此处的沙子正在上涨，必须迅速但谨慎的前进。

entry.key: COLEUS: Be cautious crossing the chasm ahead. The bridge Melorae and I crafted will do its job, but it isn’t strong.
entry.value: COLEUS: 跨过前方的的深坑时要小心。Melorea和我建造了桥，但它不是很坚固。

entry.key: COLEUS: Once on the far side, look for the tunnel hidden behind the falling sand. Follow it, and you’ll reach the shelter site.
entry.value: COLEUS: 到达洞穴对面后，寻找一个落沙后面的洞道，走过它就能到达庇护所地点。

entry.key: COLEUS: You’re doing well! There’s only a little farther left to go now until you reach the shelter site. You can rest there. Hurry, before the sand comes!
entry.value: COLEUS: 干得好！再走一小段路就能到庇护所地点了，可以在此稍加休息。在沙子到来前要抓紧！

entry.key: MELORAE: Do not follow this tunnel to its end! (Coleus and I will examine the horror that lies at its terminus later, provided we live through this.)
entry.value: MELORAE: 不要沿着这个洞道走到头！(如果我们能活下来，Coleus和我会在以后研究这个洞道尽头的可怕东西。)

entry.key: ANNONA: Of note: This passage leads to breathable air. Refill your supply tank there (we cannot tell how far or deep these tunnels may wind), but do not linger, as the area is exposed to the heat of this alien <color=lightblue>sun</color>.
entry.value: ANNONA: 注意：这个通道尽头有可呼吸的空气。在那里充满你的空气罐(以免在可能将很漫长的洞穴探索中耗尽了空气)，但不要逗留，因为那片dd区域暴露在这个外星<color=lightblue>太阳</color>的炙热之下。

entry.key: ANNONA: Refill your air supply tank and return quickly.
entry.value: ANNONA: 充满你的空气罐并迅速返回。

entry.key: RHUS: Keep moving, friends: There is nothing of interest at the end of this passage but rocks.
entry.value: RHUS: 往别处走，我的朋友。此处的通道尽头只有岩石。

entry.key: RHUS: And while these rocks are interesting, they can wait until a less urgent time.
entry.value: RHUS: 虽然这些岩石很有趣，但请等到不那么紧急的时候再来看吧。

entry.key: SOLANUM: The sands go to and fro,
entry.value: SOLANUM: The sands go to and fro,

entry.key: SOLANUM: Reversing their swift flow.
entry.value: SOLANUM: Reversing their swift flow.

entry.key: SOLANUM: If you’re inside
entry.value: SOLANUM: If you’re inside

entry.key: SOLANUM: When turns the tide,
entry.value: SOLANUM: When turns the tide,

entry.key: SOLANUM: Then skyward you should go.
entry.value: SOLANUM: Then skyward you should go.

entry.key: SOLANUM: Who was it when we last quit:
entry.value: SOLANUM: Who was it when we last quit:

entry.key: SOLANUM: Me
entry.value: SOLANUM: Me

entry.key: LAEVI: Me
entry.value: LAEVI: Me

entry.key: ILEX: I was
entry.value: ILEX: I was

entry.key: ILEX: Me again
entry.value: ILEX: Me again

entry.key: LAMI: Me!
entry.value: LAMI: Me!

entry.key: SOLANUM: Me_test
entry.value: SOLANUM: Me

entry.key: SOLANUM: Me_test2
entry.value: SOLANUM: Me

entry.key: LAMI: Me
entry.value: LAMI: Me

entry.key: TAGET: It was me
entry.value: TAGET: It was me

entry.key: SOLANUM: Me_test3
entry.value: SOLANUM: Me

entry.key: ILEX: I was_test
entry.value: ILEX: I was

entry.key: TAGET: Me again
entry.value: TAGET: Me again

entry.key: LAEVI: Me_test
entry.value: LAEVI: Me

entry.key: PYE: I’m receiving much stronger energy readings now that we’re beneath the crust. Whatever it is must lie somewhere below, closer to the <color=lightblue>comet</color>’s center. And I’m starting to think it’s more dangerous than we realized.
entry.value: PYE: 现在我们在地壳下，我收到了更强的能量度数。不管它是什么东西，它一定在接近<color=lightblue>彗星</color>中心的某处。我觉得它可能比我们想象的更加危险。

entry.key: PYE: Clary, can you hear us?
entry.value: PYE: Clary，你能听见吗？

entry.key: CLARY: Yes, but your voices are faint. I fear we will lose communication entirely if you continue any deeper.
entry.value: CLARY: 能，但你的声音很微弱。恐怕你们继续深入的话，我们之间的通讯会完全中断。

entry.key: POKE: Keep the <color=orange>shuttle</color> warm for us, Clary. We’ll return the moment we identify the source of the energy readings!
entry.value: POKE: Clary，保持<color=orange>穿梭机</color>的温度。我们在确认了能量读数的源头后就会立刻返回。

entry.key: CLARY: I understand, but... Be cautious, both of you.
entry.value: CLARY: 我明白，但...你们两个，都要小心。

entry.key: POKE: The spherical stone casing here seems to be the source of the energy readings... No, rather, the source is what’s within the stone. I’m detecting some form of exotic matter.
entry.value: POKE: 能量读数的源头似乎就是这个球形石壳...不，应该是在石壳内部。我探测到了某种异常物质。

entry.key: PYE: The stone is muting our energy readings; they should be ten times what we’re seeing, at least.
entry.value: PYE: 石壳削弱了能量读数；它们的强度应该至少是探测到的十倍。

entry.key: POKE: Pye, I don’t think we want this matter interacting with us. As far as I can tell, direct contact with it would almost certainly be fatal.
entry.value: POKE: Pye，我们不能碰到这种物质。依我所见，直接接触它将是致命的。

entry.key: PYE: I’ve never encountered anything like this casing, but it’s all that’s protecting us from what’s inside. Worse still, this matter is disturbingly volatile.
entry.value: PYE: 我从来没见到过像这样的石壳，但它是唯一能保护我们不受其中物质伤害的东西。更糟糕的是，这种物质极度不稳定。

entry.key: POKE: ...Pye. Whatever the matter inside this stone casing is, it’s more than just profoundly unstable; it’s under tonnes of pressure. Look at this density scan. I’ve never seen anything this tightly compacted before! What is this?
entry.value: POKE: ...Pye，不管石壳内的物质是什么，它可不仅仅是极度不稳定，它还承受着巨大的压力。看看这个密度扫描结果。我从来没有见到过任何物质像这样紧密的压缩在一起！这到底是什么?

entry.key: PYE: This is orders of magnitude worse than I’d imagined. If this stone were to rupture, the lethal matter within would rapidly expand, completely blanketing this star system almost instantaneously. And the pressure is still building as the <color=lightblue>comet</color> approaches this star system...
entry.value: PYE: 情况比我所想的还要糟糕的的多。如果石壳爆裂，其中的致命物质将急速扩散并几乎在一瞬间覆盖整个太阳系。而且，随着<color=lightblue>彗星</color>靠近太阳系，压力还在持续增加...

entry.key: PYE: Return to the shuttle, right now! The rest of our friends need to know they’re in terrible danger. Leave your equipment and run!
entry.value: PYE: 立刻返回穿梭机，快！其他朋友们需要知道他们正身处可怕的危险中。放下仪器，快跑！

entry.key: POKE: What are you doing, Pye?!
entry.value: POKE: Pye，你在干什么？！

entry.key: PYE: The more we know about this alien matter, the better our chances of survival. I will learn what I can here. Go, warn the others; maybe they can construct shelter somehow. ...Now, Poke!
entry.value: PYE: 我们需要更多地了解这种外星物质来增加存活的可能。我要留下来研究它。快走，警告其他人；或许他们还来得及建造庇护所。...Poke，快啊！

entry.key: CLARY: I fear our situation may be dire:
entry.value: CLARY: 我们的处境恐怕十分严峻：

entry.key: CLARY: Pye, Poke, and I landed here on this <color=lightblue>comet</color> not long after its arrival in this star system. Our <color=orange>shuttle</color>’s equipment heard strange energy readings coming from somewhere beneath the surface.
entry.value: CLARY: Pye，Poke和我在这颗<color=lightblue>彗星</color>进入这个太阳系不久后在上面着陆。我们的<color=orange>穿梭机</color>上的仪器检测到地下某处传出了异常的能量度数

entry.key: CLARY: Pye and Poke were able to locate a fissure in the ice on the <color=lightblue>comet</color>’s sunward side, and they descended inside to investigate the source of the readings.
entry.value: CLARY: Pye和Poke在<color=lightblue>彗星</color>向阳面的冰面上找到了一处裂缝，他们已进入其中去探测能量度数的源头。

entry.key: CLARY: But... Pye and my sister have been gone for a long time now. They haven’t contacted me since descending below the surface, either.
entry.value: CLARY: 但令我不安的是，Pye和我的妹妹已经离开了很长时间了。她们在进入到地表下方后就再也没联系过我。

entry.key: CLARY: Should I leave the <color=orange>shuttle</color> to look for them? I want to follow protocol, but I don’t know what I’ll do if they aren’t well...
entry.value: CLARY: 我是否应该离开<color=orange>穿梭机</color>去寻找她们？我想遵守任务规定，但万一如果她们遇到危险的话该怎么办...

entry.key: CLARY: Poke... Pye... Come back to me safely, my friends.
entry.value: CLARY: Poke...Pye...请一定要安全地回来，我的朋友们。

entry.key: CLARY: This is troublesome: It seems the <color=lightblue>comet</color> wishes to submerge our <color=orange>shuttle</color> in ice. If we stay on the surface too long, the <color=orange>shuttle</color> may freeze entirely.
entry.value: CLARY: 这可真是麻烦。这颗<color=lightblue>彗星</color>似乎想要把我们的<color=orange>穿梭机</color>冻在冰里。如果我们在地表上停留太久，<color=orange>穿梭机</color>可能会被完全冻住。

entry.key: POKE: Even if it did, couldn’t someone call it back home to the <color=orange>gravity cannon</color> on <color=lightblue>Ember Twin</color>?
entry.value: POKE: 就算它被冻住了，<color=lightblue>灰烬星</color>上<color=orange>重力砲</color>那边的人也能将它召回不是吗?

entry.key: PYE: Yes, but the exploration of the <color=lightblue>comet</color> would be more difficult if we were without the <color=orange>shuttle</color> until someone recalled it. Perhaps we shouldn’t have landed on the dark side of the <color=lightblue>comet</color>...
entry.value: PYE: 对，但如果无法方便地进出<color=orange>穿梭机</color>，在<color=lightblue>彗星</color>的探索任务将会变得更困难。可能我们就不应该在<color=lightblue>彗星</color>的背阴面着陆...

entry.key: CLARY: Suppose one of us remained in the <color=orange>shuttle</color> to keep it warm and continue monitoring the surface.
entry.value: CLARY: 我建议我们当中其中一个留在<color=orange>穿梭机</color>里保持其温度并继续监测地表。

entry.key: PYE: This would be wise, I think, Clary. If you don’t mind waiting here with it, Poke and I can continue to investigate the surface.
entry.value: PYE: Clary，那是个明智的建议。如果你不介意在穿梭机里等我们，Poke和我会继续进行地表的探索。

entry.key: <color=orange>Mining site 2b</color>
entry.value: <color=orange>采矿场2b</color>

entry.key: ALIGNMENT 1: the <color=lightblue>sun</color>
entry.value: ALIGNMENT 1: the <color=lightblue>sun</color>

entry.key: ALIGNMENT 2: the <color=lightblue>Hourglass Twins</color>
entry.value: ALIGNMENT 2: the <color=lightblue>Hourglass Twins</color>

entry.key: ALIGNMENT 3: <color=lightblue>Timber Hearth</color>
entry.value: ALIGNMENT 3: <color=lightblue>Timber Hearth</color>

entry.key: ALIGNMENT 4: <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color>
entry.value: ALIGNMENT 4: <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color>

entry.key: ALIGNMENT 5: <color=lightblue>Giant's Deep</color>
entry.value: ALIGNMENT 5: <color=lightblue>Giant's Deep</color>

entry.key: Self
entry.value: 自己

entry.key: Start...Whoa.
SelfStartWhat the heck happened?
entry.value: 这是怎么回事？

entry.key: SelfStartThis is the greatest day of my life!
entry.value: 这真是我这辈子最美好的一天!

entry.key: SelfStartAre you me from the last loop?
entry.value: 你是来自上个循环的我吗？

entry.key: SelfStartThis got weird in a hurry.
entry.value: 这一切都突然变得怪异起来了。

entry.key: SelfStartAAAAAAAAAAHHHH!
entry.value: 啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊！

entry.key: Confused1If you're me, then I'm as confused as you are.
entry.value: 如果你是我的话，那我和你一样困惑。

entry.key: SelfConfused1Do you think we have the same memories?
entry.value: 你觉得我们的记忆相同吗？

entry.key: SelfConfused1Do you think it's okay there's two of us?
entry.value: 你觉得同时存在两个自己会没事吗？

entry.key: Memories0BGood question. Let's see...
entry.value: 问得好。让我想想...

entry.key: Memories1I remember all the time loops, including last loop when I jumped into the black hole in here. What about you?
entry.value: 我记得所有的时间循环的事，包括在上个循环我跳进了上面那个黑洞。你呢？

entry.key: SelfMemories1Me, too. Sounds like our memories diverge at the start of this loop.
entry.value: 我也一样。似乎我们的记忆在这个循环开始出现了不同。

entry.key: SelfMemories1Same, except I woke up at the campfire, like always.
entry.value: 差不多，除了这次我和之前一样是在篝火处醒来的。

entry.key: WokeUp1BIt makes sense one of the two versions of us would start at the campfire as usual.
entry.value: 我们当中的其中一个像之前一样在篝火处醒来是合理的。

entry.key: WokeUp1CMakes sense to me, seeing how jumping into the black hole is definitely what created two of us.
entry.value: 有道理，跳进黑洞肯定就是产生了两个我的原因。

entry.key: CLARY: Regarding the warp towers on <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color>: Does each tower have to be perfectly aligned with the center of the astral body to which it’s tuned?
entry.value: CLARY: 关于<color=lightblue>灰烬星</color>上的跃迁塔我有一个疑问：每座塔是否必须准确地对准其对应天体的中心？

entry.key: CLARY: I enjoy precision as much as the next Nomai, but if, for example, a tower’s base were to shift even slightly, that tower might no longer align with its astral body.
entry.value: CLARY: 我和我身边的Nomai人一样喜欢精确，但如果，举例而言，一座塔的地基稍有偏差，那座塔就可能无法再对准其对应的天体了。

entry.key: POKE: We don’t need the alignment angle to be exact; it only needs to be within five degrees of the astral body’s center.
entry.value: POKE: 对准角不需要完全准确；只需在天体中心的五度范围内即可。

entry.key: POKE: Of note: This gives us a slightly longer warp window. I imagine this window will last roughly several seconds.
entry.value: POKE: 需要注意的是：这使得跃迁窗口的持续时间稍长一些。我认为窗口会持续大约数秒。

entry.key: POKE: As such, any Nomai stepping onto the warp platform during the active window will be immediately warped. We will need to be careful around the platform for the duration of the time it’s active to avoid accidental transportation.
entry.value: POKE: 在这种情况下，任何在窗口激活时踏上跃迁平台的人都会被立刻跃迁。因此，窗口激活期间，在跃迁平台附近活动时需要小心，以免发生意外的传送。

entry.key: CLARY: More accurately, I enjoy precision as much as the next Nomai, provided the next Nomai is not Poke.
entry.value: CLARY: 更准确的说，我和我身边的Nomai人一样喜欢精确，前提是那人不是Poke.

entry.key: ROOT: Where am I taking this first black hole core? (And where am I taking the remaining cores once they’re ready?)
entry.value: ROOT: 我该把这第一颗黑洞核心送到哪里？ (其他核心制造完成后我又应该将它们送去哪里？)

entry.key: CLARY: All of the warp towers are being constructed on <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color>, so the black hole cores will go there.
entry.value: CLARY: 所有的跃迁塔都建造在<color=lightblue>灰烬星</color>上，所以黑洞核心都要送到那里去。

entry.key: POKE: The white hole cores are for the warp receivers. Each of the six receivers are being constructed at different locations, so those deliveries will be a greater pain in your cervical spine.
entry.value: POKE: 白洞核心都要安装在跃迁接收器上。六个接收器都分别建造在了不同的地点，运送它们的任务可要让你的颈椎剧烈疼痛了。

entry.key: ROOT: My gratitude! In that case: Poke, Clary, I’m leaving for delivery! I’ll send Yarrow your regards.
entry.value: ROOT: 感谢你们！那样的话：Poke，Clary，我要去进行运送任务了！我会代你们向Yarrow问好的。

entry.key: CLARY: Poke, I’ll return to the <color=orange>forge</color> shortly; I’m going to catch up to Root and help him deliver the first core to <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color>, just to make sure Yarrow receives it.
entry.value: CLARY: Poke，我很快就会回到<color=orange>锻造室</color>；我要跟上Root去帮助他把第一颗核心运送到<color=lightblue>灰烬星</color>，我得确保Yarrow能收到它。

entry.key: POKE: Of course you are.
entry.value: POKE: 我当然相信你会很快回来的。

entry.key: POKE: The tower designs in the <color=orange>High Energy Lab</color> on <color=lightblue>Ember Twin</color> reveal each receiver's location. Ask Yarrow; he is familiar with them.
entry.value: POKE: <color=lightblue>余烬星</color>上的<color=orange>高能实验室</color>里的跃迁塔设计图展示了每个接收器的位置。有疑问可以找Yarrow，他对此很熟悉。

entry.key: WARNING: Be cautious near the boarding area while the <color=orange>Black Hole Forge</color> is in operation.
entry.value: 警告：请不要在<color=orange>黑洞锻造室</color>升降时靠近对接区域。

entry.key: POKE: Of note: Yarrow believes he spotted a flaw in the warp tower designs: namely, that one of the warp towers on <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color> will never activate, because its warp receiver will never align overhead.
entry.value: POKE: 值得注意的是：Yarrow以为他发现了跃迁塔设计的一处缺陷：即<color=lightblue>灰烬星</color>上有一座跃迁塔将永远无法启动，因为其跃迁接收器永远不能在其正上方与之对齐。

entry.key: POKE: Does your romantic interest think a warp tower’s alignment point is its receiver? Does he not know that a warp tower always aligns with the center of its corresponding astral body?
entry.value: POKE: 你的恋爱对象是不是以为跃迁塔的对准点是它的接收器？他难道不知道跃迁塔只需对准其对应天体的中心吗？

entry.key: CLARY: That isn’t an unreasonable belief, given the receiver does have to be located on (or in close orbit around) the relevant astral body.
entry.value: CLARY: 他的想法是可以理解的，因为接收器确实必须位于对应天体上(或者位于环绕该天体的低轨道上)。

entry.key: CLARY: I seem to recall that was your understanding of warp technology, at first.
entry.value: CLARY: 我似乎还记得你以前对跃迁科技的理解不也是这样吗。

entry.key: CLARY: No, Yarrow understands the distinction. He likely doesn’t realize the <color=lightblue>Hourglass Twins</color> are so close together they function as a single astral body, with a shared alignment point in between them.
entry.value: CLARY: 不，Yarrow当然知道跃迁塔的原理。他很可能只是没有意识到<color=lightblue>沙漏双星</color>间的距离很近，因此它们可以被看做单个天体，而它们的共用对准点位于它们之间。

entry.key: Exit to surface.
entry.value: 到地表的出口。

entry.key: <color=orange>Black Hole Forge</color>\\n(north 40m)
entry.value: <color=orange>黑洞锻造室</color>\\n(向北40m)

entry.key: PYE: The Ash Twin Project will be one of our biggest undertakings (metaphorically and physically). To build it, we need a way to travel quickly between Ash Twin and each location that holds crucial project materials.
entry.value: PYE: <color=orange>灰烬星工程</color>将是我们进行过的 (无论是理论上的还是实际上的) 最艰巨的任务。 我们需要一种能快速往返<color=lightblue>灰烬星</color>与各个工程关键材料储存地点之间的移动方式，以方便工程任务的进行。

entry.key: ROOT: What if we used warp towers (like the one we have on the <color=orange>White Hole Station</color>) to connect <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color> directly to each critical location?
entry.value: ROOT: 用跃迁塔 (就像<color=orange>白洞站</color>) 来连接<color=lightblue>灰烬星</color>与各重要地点，如何？

entry.key: CLARY: Poke, Root, and I can begin work on this immediately in the <color=orange>Black Hole Forge</color> (this will keep us busy!).
entry.value: CLARY: Poke, Root和我可以立即在<color=orange>黑洞锻造室</color>着手进行这个制造任务 (我们已经迫不及待了！)。

entry.key: YARROW: Of note: Each tower on <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color> will warp to a different planet.
entry.value: YARROW: 注意：<color=lightblue>灰烬星</color>上的每座跃迁塔会分别跃迁到不同的行星。

entry.key: PHLOX: We can design each tower to visually reflect its warp destination!
entry.value: PHLOX: 我们可以按照每座跃迁塔目的地的特点来分别设计他们的外观。

entry.key: PHLOX: The <color=orange>Giant’s Deep tower</color>, for instance, could resemble a cyclone. And we could model the <color=orange>Timber Hearth tower</color> after a geyser mountain!
entry.value: PHLOX: 举例而言，可以将<color=orange>深巨星</color>跃迁塔设计为气旋的样式。而<color=orange>木炉星</color>跃迁塔则可以设计为间歇泉山的样式！

entry.key: YARROW: My gratitude to those who noted my imprecise language! Yes, the <color=lightblue>sun</color> is not a planet. I believe this has been sufficiently clarified (kindly stop reminding me!).
entry.value: YARROW: 感谢你们指出我用词的不准确！没错，<color=lightblue>太阳</color>不是一颗行星。我想这样说就足够澄清了 (请不要再提醒我了！)。

entry.key: Retrieving previous launch data from <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color>.
entry.value: 从<color=lightblue>灰烬星</color>获取之前的发射数据。

entry.key: Total number of probes launched: <NbTimeloops>
entry.value: 发射的探测器总数：<NbTimeloops>

entry.key: Deep space anomaly matching all known criteria for the <color=lightblue>Eye of the universe</color> found by probe <FirstLoop>.
entry.value: 探测器<FirstLoop>找到了符合<color=lightblue>宇宙之眼</color>所有已知特征的深空异常现象。

entry.key: CLARY: I have good news, Yarrow! The advanced warp core is ready to be installed in the central chamber of <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color>.
entry.value: CLARY: Yarrow，我有一个好消息！高级跃迁核心已经可以安装到<color=lightblue>灰烬星</color>的中央舱室内了！

entry.key: YARROW: I’m intrigued, love! Everyone here working on the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color> is excited to see it (Pye is beside herself with joy!).
entry.value: YARROW: 我太期待了，亲爱的！参与<color=orange>灰烬星工程</color>每个人都很激动的想要看它（Pye高兴得不得了！）。

entry.key: POKE: No, it isn’t!
entry.value: POKE: 不，它还不能！

entry.key: YARROW: Is everything well at the <color=orange>forge</color>?
entry.value: YARROW: <color=orange>锻造室</color>里一切都还好吗？

entry.key: CLARY: Don’t worry, love; Poke is only nervous. The core is extraordinary, and her design work is beautifully clever.
entry.value: CLARY: 别担心，亲爱的; Poke只是太紧张了。核心非常完美，她的设计成果也非常的精巧。

entry.key: POKE: The core’s durability could still be improved! I need more time!
entry.value: POKE: 核心的耐受性还可以继续改进！我还需要一些时间！

entry.key: CLARY: Ignore her, Yarrow. The core is finished. And if my sister tells you otherwise, then she will be finished, as well.
entry.value: CLARY: 别理她，Yarrow。核心的制造工作已经结束了。如果我的妹妹再这么说，那么她，也将被结束。

entry.key: YARROW: My gratitude for the latest shipment, Oeno! This ore should be the last we’ll need for the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color>.
entry.value: YARROW: Oeno，感谢你最近的运输! 这应该是<color=orange>灰烬星工程</color>需要的最后一种矿石了。

entry.key: YARROW: Once we’ve finished the shell that seals off the central chamber, we’ll check to ensure there are no longer any physical entrances. Ramie and I will be checking the interior and then the exterior for cracks (our final safety check).
entry.value: YARROW: 一旦我们完成了用于密封中央舱室的外壳后，就会进行检查确保没有任何入口。 Ramie和我会检查壳体内部和外部是否有裂口 (这是最后的安全检查)。

entry.key: OENO: This is exciting news! Can I offer an extra set of eyes for this final check (specifically, mine)? If my work here is complete, I’d be delighted to help.
entry.value: OENO: 真是令人激动的消息！介意多一个人加入检查吗（我的意思是，我）？我很愿意在这里的工作完成后来帮忙。

entry.key: YARROW: We’d be grateful if you would! The more eyes, the better, as the smallest flaw or opening in the shell that protects the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color> could lead to disaster.
entry.value: YARROW: 我们会很感谢你来帮忙的！多一组眼睛，就多一分安全，因为哪怕保护<color=orange>灰烬星工程</color>的壳体上有一点小小的缺陷和开口都将造成可怕的灾难。

entry.key: OENO: I’m still amazed by how much ore the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color> requires!
entry.value: OENO: <color=orange>灰烬星工程</color>所需的矿石量还是大得让我感到惊讶不已！

entry.key: CYCAD: Isn’t this the ore for the remaining towers being built on <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color>? The completed towers I’ve seen are quite large!
entry.value: CYCAD: 这是不是用来制造<color=lightblue>灰烬星</color>上剩余跃迁塔的矿石? 我看见已完工的跃迁塔真是巨大啊！

entry.key: OENO: No, the material for those towers is all being taken from <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color>. The ore we’re mining here will be used to craft an immensely thick protective shell that will physically seal off the chamber inside <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color>’s core.
entry.value: OENO: 不，建造那些跃迁塔的材料都取自<color=lightblue>灰烬星</color>。在这里采掘的矿石会用于建造一个将<color=lightblue>灰烬星</color>核心内的腔室完全封闭起来的非常厚的保护壳。

entry.key: COLEUS: I’m relieved by our clan’s decision to use <color=lightblue>Timber Hearth</color>’s ore only for constructing the shell. If, eventually, life on this planet were to evolve to the point of advanced metallurgy, I’m confident we won’t have destroyed their ability to create!
entry.value: COLEUS: 我们家族只将<color=lightblue>木炉星</color>的矿石用于建造保护壳的决定让我松了一口气。 假如有朝一日这颗行星上的生命进化到了拥有先进冶金技术的程度，我相信我们不会毁掉了他们进行制造的能力！

entry.key: CYCAD: If they're sealing off all entrances, I hope they've planned a-core-dingly!
entry.value: CYCAD: 如果他们要密封所有的入口，那我希望他们已有核离的计划！

entry.key: OENO: I thought you had forbidden your apprentice from making puns, Coleus.
entry.value: OENO: Coleus，我以为你已经禁止你的学徒讲谐音段子了呢。

entry.key: COLEUS: How else would he improve?
entry.value: COLEUS: 不然他怎么能说的更好呢？

entry.key: <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color> warp network status: All towers online.
entry.value: <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color> warp network status: All towers online.

entry.key: <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color> warp network status: <color=orange>Sun tower</color> offline as of <MinutesSinceRedGiant> minutes <SecondsSinceRedGiant> seconds ago.\\nAll other towers online.
entry.value: <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color> warp network status: <color=orange>Sun tower</color> offline as of <MinutesSinceRedGiant> minutes <SecondsSinceRedGiant> seconds ago.\\nAll other towers online.

entry.key: Sun tower offline as of <MinutesSinceRedGiant> minutes <SecondsSinceRedGiant> seconds ago.\\nAll other towers online.
entry.value: 太阳塔在<MinutesSinceRedGiant>分<SecondsSinceRedGiant>秒前离线.\\n其他跃迁塔均在线。

entry.key: POKE: Welcome to the <color=orange>White Hole Station</color>! If you fell through the black hole by accident (don't worry, you aren’t the first), this warp tower can return you to <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color>.
entry.value: POKE: 欢迎来到<color=orange>白洞站</color>！如果你不小心掉进了黑洞来到这里(别担心，你不是第一个)，这座跃迁塔能送你回到<color=lightblue>碎空星</color>。

entry.key: POKE: Every warp tower is tuned to a specific astral body. A tower's warp can only be used during the brief window when the tower is aligned with its corresponding astral body (in this case, <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color>).
entry.value: POKE: 每座跃迁塔都和一个特定的天体相匹配。跃迁塔只能在匹配的天体与之对准的短暂时间窗口进行跃迁(以这座为例就是<color=lightblue>碎空星</color>)。

entry.key: You must be standing on the warp platform on the floor during this alignment to be warped.
entry.value: POKE: 你必须在对准时站在地板上的跃迁平台上以进行跃迁。

entry.key: POKE: If you look up while the station is rotating, you can see the alignment happens when the astral body is directly overhead.
entry.value: POKE: 当白洞站旋转时向上看，如果天体在头顶上方，你将能看对准的过程。

entry.key: Gabbro
entry.value: Gabbro

entry.key: MeetGabbro3FNice, it’s you. Good to see you made it here in one piece. The first solo launch is a doozy, isn’t it?
entry.value: Nice, it’s you. Good to see you made it here in one piece. The first solo launch is a doozy, isn’t it?

entry.key: MeetGabbro3FSo hey, don’t freak out or anything, but lately I keep, like, dying repeatedly. I dunno, it’s pretty weird.
entry.value: So hey, don’t freak out or anything, but lately I keep, like, dying repeatedly. I dunno, it’s pretty weird.

entry.key: MeetGabbro3FWhat about you? Have you died lately, or is it just me?
entry.value: What about you? Have you died lately, or is it just me?

entry.key: GabbroMeetGabbro3FNo, it’s me, too. We’re in a time loop.
entry.value: No, it’s me, too. We’re in a time loop.

entry.key: Gabbro3F_2Time has been behaving unusually lately. Yeah, a time loop makes sense. Cool.
entry.value: Time has been behaving unusually lately. Yeah, a time loop makes sense. Cool.

entry.key: GabbroGabbro3F_2You’re taking this pretty well.
entry.value: You’re taking this pretty well.

entry.key: GabbroGabbro3F_2What did you think it was?
entry.value: What did you think it was?

entry.key: Gabbro3F_3Heh, right back at you.
entry.value: Heh, right back at you.

entry.key: Gabbro3F_3Personally, I like new experiences, and I’ve never been in a time loop before. I mean, I don’t think I’ve been in a time loop before this one.
entry.value: Personally, I like new experiences, and I’ve never been in a time loop before. I mean, I don’t think I’ve been in a time loop before this one.

entry.key: Gabbro3F_4I figured it’d be some kind of fidgety time business, but I wasn’t really thinking about what’s happening to the shape of time, you know? But a loop makes sense here. Let’s go with “loop” for now.
entry.value: I figured it’d be some kind of fidgety time business, but I wasn’t really thinking about what’s happening to the shape of time, you know? But a loop makes sense here. Let’s go with “loop” for now.

entry.key: Gabbro3F_5It looks like you and I are the only ones who can tell that time’s gone all weird. I tried radioing Hornfels and asking if they’d died, too, but they thought I was being metaphorical.
entry.value: It looks like you and I are the only ones who can tell that time’s gone all weird. I tried radioing Hornfels and asking if they’d died, too, but they thought I was being metaphorical.

entry.key: Gabbro3F_5Even if I tell Hornfels about the time loop, they never remember by the next one. They don’t realize anything’s different.
entry.value: Even if I tell Hornfels about the time loop, they never remember by the next one. They don’t realize anything’s different.

entry.key: Gabbro3F_5And here’s another weird one for you - every time I die, all of my memories from that loop replay back to me. I’m pretty sure that’s related to this big stone Nomai statue I found on one of the other islands.
entry.value: And here’s another weird one for you - every time I die, all of my memories from that loop replay back to me. I’m pretty sure that’s related to this big stone Nomai statue I found on one of the other islands.

entry.key: Gabbro3F_5I was looking at it, and the statue opened its eyes and started glowing. It replayed my memories like it’d seen them through my own eyes, just like what happens each time I die.
entry.value: I was looking at it, and the statue opened its eyes and started glowing. It replayed my memories like it’d seen them through my own eyes, just like what happens each time I die.

entry.key: GabbroGabbro3F_5That happened to me with the statue at the museum.
entry.value: That happened to me with the statue at the museum.

entry.key: Gabbro3F_6You too, huh? Then the Nomai statues must have something to do with why we’re the only ones aware of the time loop. So... no glowing statue, no time loop awareness?
entry.value: You too, huh? Then the Nomai statues must have something to do with why we’re the only ones aware of the time loop. So... no glowing statue, no time loop awareness?

entry.key: Gabbro3F_6I think that’s going to be my leading theory, but if you find out anything new about the statues or the time loop, let me know, okay? I’ll be here.
entry.value: I think that’s going to be my leading theory, but if you find out anything new about the statues or the time loop, let me know, okay? I’ll be here.

entry.key: Gabbro3F_6Anyway, that’s what’s new with me. But hey, this is your first solo voyage! ...Kind of! Let’s talk about you, you know?
entry.value: Anyway, that’s what’s new with me. But hey, this is your first solo voyage! ...Kind of! Let’s talk about you, you know?

entry.key: Gabbro3F_SecondaryHave you ever watched a cyclone for so long, it started to hypnotize you? I’m telling you, they’ll put you in a trance if you stare at ’em long enough.
entry.value: Have you ever watched a cyclone for so long, it started to hypnotize you? I’m telling you, they’ll put you in a trance if you stare at ’em long enough.

entry.key: GabbroMenuHow’s space treating you?
entry.value: How’s space treating you?

entry.key: GabbroGabbroMenuI found something!
entry.value: I found something!

entry.key: GabbroGabbroMenuWhat are you doing out here?
entry.value: What are you doing out here?

entry.key: GabbroGabbroMenuWhere should I explore on Giant’s Deep?
entry.value: Where should I explore on Giant’s Deep?

entry.key: GabbroGabbroMenuWhat’s up with this planet?
entry.value: What’s up with this planet?

entry.key: GabbroGabbroMenuWhere’s your ship?
entry.value: Where’s your ship?

entry.key: GabbroGabbroMenuI found your ship!
entry.value: I found your ship!

entry.key: GabbroGabbroMenuI saw your ship again.
entry.value: I saw your ship again.

entry.key: GabbroGabbroMenuSee you later.
entry.value: See you later.

entry.key: WhatAreYouDoing_3FWell, what are any of us doing here, really?
entry.value: Well, what are any of us doing here, really?

entry.key: WhatAreYouDoing_3F...Nah, I’m just kidding. I’m out here exploring our solar system, same as you.
entry.value: ...Nah, I’m just kidding. I’m out here exploring our solar system, same as you.

entry.key: WhatAreYouDoing_3FBut I tell you what, outer space really gives you room to think. It’s quiet and peaceful out here.
entry.value: But I tell you what, outer space really gives you room to think. It’s quiet and peaceful out here.

entry.key: WhatAreYouDoing_3FI mean, it’s usually quiet and peaceful. Sometimes a cyclone comes by and lifts my little island paradise clean out of the water. Then: less peaceful.
entry.value: I mean, it’s usually quiet and peaceful. Sometimes a cyclone comes by and lifts my little island paradise clean out of the water. Then: less peaceful.

entry.key: WhereToExplore_3FHere’s something you might like — I keep seeing a bright flash in the sky at the start of every loop. Something must be happening up there in orbit around the planet.
entry.value: Here’s something you might like — at the start of every time loop, I keep seeing a bright flash in the sky. Something must be happening up there in orbit around the planet.

entry.key: WhereToExplore_3FWhat else, what else... Have you been to Statue Island? That’s what I’ve been calling it, seeing as it’s the island where I found the glowing Nomai statue. ...Get it?
entry.value: What else, what else... Have you been to Statue Island? That’s what I’ve been calling it, seeing as it’s the island where I found the glowing Nomai statue. ...Get it?

entry.key: WhereToExplore_3FI was on the beach on Statue Island when the whole glowy business happened, by the way. It’s a nice beach for that kind of thing. I give it a solid 7 out of 10 on the Gabbro Relaxation Scale.
entry.value: I was on the beach on Statue Island when the whole glowy business happened, by the way. It’s a nice beach for that kind of thing. I give it a solid 7 out of 10 on the Gabbro Relaxation Scale.

entry.key: WhereToExplore_3FIf you feel like checking out Statue Island, it’s the one with two islands connected by a natural rock arch. Well... mostly connected, anyway. You’ll see.
entry.value: If you feel like checking out Statue Island, it’s the one with two islands connected by a natural rock arch. Well... mostly connected, anyway. You’ll see.

entry.key: ThisPlanet_3FHaha, I know, right?
entry.value: Haha, I know, right?

entry.key: ThisPlanet_3F...Oh, you meant, like, tell you more about it? I gotcha. Well, Giant’s Deep is massive, and mostly water. No surprises there.
entry.value: ...Oh, you meant, like, tell you more about it? I gotcha. Well, Giant’s Deep is massive, and mostly water. No surprises there.

entry.key: ThisPlanet_3FThere’s a strong current a ways beneath the surface that prevents anything from sinking below it. Seriously, I tried everything I could think of to get past that current, and neither idea worked.
entry.value: There’s a strong current a ways beneath the surface that prevents anything from sinking below it. Seriously, I tried everything I could think of to get past that current, and neither idea worked.

entry.key: ThisPlanet_3FAs for land masses, I’ve counted four islands, including this one. There’s also the one with that Nomai statue I saw on the beach.
entry.value: As for land masses, I’ve counted four islands, including this one. There’s also the one with that Nomai statue I saw on the beach.

entry.key: ThisPlanet_3FYou’ve seen the cyclones? Yeah, they’re hard to miss. They’ll toss up everything in their path, islands included. Little tip — if you get picked up, try to land in water. Less likely to kill you.
entry.value: You’ve seen the cyclones? Yeah, they’re hard to miss. They’ll toss up everything in their path, islands included. Little tip — if you get picked up, try to land in water. Less likely to kill you.

entry.key: GabbrosShipThat’s a good question.
entry.value: That’s a good question.

entry.key: GabbrosShipIt’s definitely on this planet somewhere. I mean, unless a cyclone came by and tossed it into space, I guess. Heh, that would be pretty nuts.
entry.value: It’s definitely on this planet somewhere. I mean, unless a cyclone came by and tossed it into space, I guess. Heh, that would be pretty nuts.

entry.key: GabbrosShipI hope it’s not lonely.
entry.value: I hope it’s not lonely.

entry.key: GabbrosShip2An excellent question. I haven’t seen it around lately.
entry.value: An excellent question. I haven’t seen it around lately.

entry.key: GabbrosShip2I hope it’s not lonely.
entry.value: I hope it’s not lonely.

entry.key: GabbrosShip3Oh, cool. So it’s floating in the ocean, huh?
entry.value: Oh, cool. So it’s floating in the ocean, huh?

entry.key: GabbrosShip3Did it look like it was having a good time?
entry.value: Did it look like it was having a good time?

entry.key: GabbrosShip4I hope it’s having fun! Did you say hi for me?
entry.value: I hope it’s having fun! Did you say hi for me?

entry.key: GoodbyeCool, cool. Take it easy out there.
entry.value: Cool, cool. Take it easy out there.

entry.key: FoundSomethingMenuNice, nice. Whatcha got for me?
entry.value: Nice, nice. Whatcha got for me?

entry.key: GabbroFoundSomethingMenuI reached the inside of Statue Island.
entry.value: I reached the inside of Statue Island.

entry.key: GabbroFoundSomethingMenuI found the source of the time loop.
entry.value: I found the source of the time loop.

entry.key: GabbroFoundSomethingMenuI found Nomai masks inside the Ash Twin Project.
entry.value: I found Nomai masks inside the Ash Twin Project.

entry.key: GabbroFoundSomethingMenuI found what happened to the Orbital Probe Cannon.
entry.value: I found what happened to the Orbital Probe Cannon.

entry.key: GabbroFoundSomethingMenuI found your quantum poem.
entry.value: I found your quantum poem.

entry.key: GabbroFoundSomethingMenuI found a photo of you inside the old radio tower.
entry.value: I found a photo of you inside the old radio tower.

entry.key: GabbroFoundSomethingMenuActually, nevermind.
entry.value: Actually, nevermind.

entry.key: FoundSomething1_3FSo the Nomai created those head statues to record memories, huh? ...Yeah, I could see the Nomai doing that. Not sure what for, but it seems like their sort of thing.
entry.value: So the Nomai created those head statues to record memories, huh? ...Yeah, I could see the Nomai doing that. Not sure what for, but it seems like their sort of thing.

entry.key: FoundSomething1_3FDo you think the statues are recording our memories, then? ’Cause I remember that one on the beach looked at me funny. That must be my memory-friend!
entry.value: Do you think the statues are recording our memories, then? ’Cause I remember that one on the beach looked at me funny. That must be my memory-friend!

entry.key: FoundSomething1bRight, right, the cavern inside Statue Island is where the memory-recording statues were made, I remember.
entry.value: Right, right, the cavern inside Statue Island is where the memory-recording statues were made, I remember.

entry.key: FoundSomething1bSo your memory statue is the one in the museum back in the crater, and mine’s the one I found on the beach. I kinda dig having my own personal memory-friend.
entry.value: So your memory statue is the one in the museum back in the crater, and mine’s the one I found on the beach. I kinda dig having my own personal memory-friend.

entry.key: FoundSomething1bIf you come up with any hunches about what the Nomai wanted to record memories for, feel free to run them by me! You know where I’ll be.
entry.value: If you come up with any hunches about what the Nomai wanted to record memories for, feel free to run them by me! You know where I’ll be.

entry.key: FoundSomething2_3FWait, whoa, really? The Nomai carved out Ash Twin and built a time loop device inside? ...That is wild.
entry.value: Wait, whoa, really? The Nomai carved out the Ash Twin and built a time loop device inside? ...That is wild.

entry.key: FoundSomething2_3FNow we know what’s causing the loop, then. And... if it’s caused by a device, that must mean it had to be switched on, right? Huh...
entry.value: Now we know what’s causing the loop, then. And... if it’s caused by a device, that must mean it had to be switched on, right? Huh...

entry.key: FoundSomething2_3FHey, what do you think would happen if you turned off the time loop? Like, there’s a part of me thinks maybe you shouldn’t, what with the sun blowing up and all.
entry.value: Hey, what do you think would happen if you turned off the time loop? Like, there’s a part of me thinks maybe you shouldn’t, what with the sun blowing up and all.

entry.key: FoundSomething2_3FThen again, who wants to spend eternity being blown up by the sun?
entry.value: Then again, who wants to spend eternity being blown up by the sun?

entry.key: FoundSomething2_3F...I dunno, I’m no time loop expert. I’m just gonna sit here and ponder the intricacies of time and space. Maybe take a nap, too, if I feel like it.
entry.value: ...I dunno, I’m no time loop expert. I’m just gonna sit here and ponder the intricacies of time and space. Maybe take a nap, too, if I feel like it.

entry.key: FoundSomething2bMy head’s still all full of scenarios for what would happen if you turned off the time loop. I’ll probably notice if you decide to mess with it, though, right? Seems like something I’d notice.
entry.value: My head’s still all full of scenarios for what would happen if you turned off the time loop. I’ll probably notice if you decide to mess with it, though, right? Seems like something I’d notice.

entry.key: FoundSomething2bThis is all pretty wild.
entry.value: This is all pretty wild.

entry.key: FoundSomething3_3FYou’re saying the statues were made so memories could be sent back in time? I guess that makes sense, considering we both have our memories of every loop we’ve gone through.
entry.value: You’re saying the statues were made so memories could be sent back in time? I guess that makes sense, considering we both have our memories of every loop we’ve gone through.

entry.key: FoundSomething3_3FWait, then it’s just our memories being sent back in time to us, right? Then... are we really experiencing multiple time loops, or not?
entry.value: Wait, then it’s just our memories being sent back in time to us, right? Then... are we really experiencing multiple time loops, or not?

entry.key: FoundSomething3_3FThat’s pretty deep... Like, maybe our consciousnesses have been through all these loops, but maybe our bodies haven’t, because technically the loops never happened.
entry.value: That’s pretty deep... Like, maybe our consciousnesses have been through all these loops, but maybe our bodies haven’t, because technically the loops never happened.

entry.key: FoundSomething3_3FMeaning we’re receiving memories of things that will never happen to us. Cool, huh?
entry.value: Meaning we’re receiving memories of things that will never happen to us. Cool, huh?

entry.key: FoundSomething3bRight, you told me earlier that the point of the statues is to send memories back in time. Which I guess makes sense, considering we both have our memories of every loop we’ve gone through.
entry.value: Right, you told me earlier that the point of the statues is to send memories back in time. Which I guess makes sense, considering we both have our memories of every loop we’ve gone through.

entry.key: FoundSomething3bI thought about it some more, and I think that means our minds have gone through all these loops, but we haven’t actually gone through them ourselves.
entry.value: I thought about it some more, and I think that means our minds have gone through all these loops, but we haven’t actually gone through them ourselves.

entry.key: FoundSomething3bMeaning we’re receiving memories of things that technically will never happen to us. Cool, huh?
entry.value: Meaning we’re receiving memories of things that technically will never happen to us. Cool, huh?

entry.key: FoundSomething4_3FWhoa, that’s the cannon breaking apart at the start of each time loop? For real?
entry.value: Whoa, that’s the cannon breaking apart at the start of each time loop? For real?

entry.key: FoundSomething4_3FDid you figure out why?
entry.value: Did you figure out why?

entry.key: GabbroFoundSomething4_3FToo much power.
entry.value: Too much power.

entry.key: GabbroFoundSomething4_3FOverenthusiasm.
entry.value: Overenthusiasm.

entry.key: FoundSomething4FollowUp_3F...It’s kind of scary how much that sounds like something Slate or Feldspar would do. I’m pretty surprised the Nomai built something that actually broke!
entry.value: ...It’s kind of scary how much that sounds like something Slate or Feldspar would do. I’m pretty surprised the Nomai built something that actually broke!

entry.key: FoundSomething4FollowUp_3FCome to think of it, though, “broke” might be the wrong word. Because it looks like the Orbital Probe Cannon is still firing successfully at the beginning of each time loop.
entry.value: Come to think of it, though, “broke” might be the wrong word. Because it looks like the Orbital Probe Cannon is still firing successfully at the beginning of each time loop.

entry.key: FoundSomething4b_3FSo the cannon breaks apart right after it launches, huh. Explains what I’m seeing fall from the sky every loop.
entry.value: So the cannon breaks apart right after it launches, huh. Explains what I’m seeing fall from the sky every loop.

entry.key: FoundSomething4b_3FI’m still surprised the Nomai built something that isn’t holding together, you know? Them being genius crafters and all.
entry.value: I’m still surprised the Nomai built something that isn’t holding together, you know? Them being genius crafters and all.

entry.key: FoundSomething4b_3FOn the other hand, maybe we should be impressed they made something that could last until modern day in the first place. And it looks like the cannon is still firing successfully at the start of each time loop.
entry.value: On the other hand, maybe we should be impressed they made something that could last until modern day in the first place. And it looks like the cannon is still firing successfully at the start of each time loop.

entry.key: FoundSomething5_3FYeah, the one in the woods, I remember writing that. Pretty fun, right? It works out to a good 24 poems.
entry.value: Yeah, the one in the woods, I remember writing that. Pretty fun, right? It works out to a good 24 poems.

entry.key: FoundSomething5_3FWhen I’m done exploring, I want to make some more quantum art. Maybe some kind of creature sculpture that just, like, shows up and scares the daylights out of you.
entry.value: When I’m done exploring, I want to make some more quantum art. Maybe some kind of creature sculpture that just, like, shows up and scares the daylights out of you.

entry.key: FoundSomething6AgainYeah, you mentioned that before. Did I look busy in it? I hope I looked busy.
entry.value: Yeah, you mentioned that before. Did I look busy in it? I hope I looked busy.

entry.key: FoundSomething6BaseNice. Did I look busy in it? I hope I looked busy.
entry.value: Nice. Did I look busy in it? I hope I looked busy.

entry.key: FoundSomething6Must have been from the time Hornfels sent me to check on the deep space satellite. They thought Ol’ Spacey might be malfunctioning, but I couldn’t find a single thing wrong with it.
entry.value: Must have been from the time Hornfels sent me to check on the deep space satellite. They thought Ol’ Spacey might be malfunctioning, but I couldn’t find a single thing wrong with it.

entry.key: FoundSomething6Which is probably how it got a shot of my beautiful be-helmeted face, come to think of it.
entry.value: Which is probably how it got a shot of my beautiful be-helmeted face, come to think of it.

entry.key: FoundSomething6I always thought it was kinda sweet that the best way to find Ol’ Spacey is to use a map that’s generated by the satellite itself, isn’t it? Like it’s inviting us to visit. Good ol’ deep space satellite, always making sure we know where we’re going.
entry.value: I always thought it was kinda sweet that the best way to find Ol’ Spacey is to use a map that’s generated by the satellite itself, isn’t it? Like it’s inviting us to visit. Good ol’ deep space satellite, always making sure we know where we’re going.

entry.key: GabbroFoundSomething6Um. “Ol’ Spacey”?
entry.value: Um. “Ol’ Spacey”?

entry.key: GabbroFoundSomething6I have a map?!
entry.value: I have a map?!

entry.key: FoundSomething6aDunno. Hornfels probably told me why, but Hornfels tells me lots of things, and sometimes I tune out. Or pretend there’s signal interference and I can’t hear them.
entry.value: Dunno. Hornfels probably told me why, but Hornfels tells me lots of things, and sometimes I tune out. Or pretend there’s signal interference and I can’t hear them.

entry.key: FoundSomething6aBest guess says the deep space satellite must have sent Timber Hearth some weird pictures, but like… what’s considered “weird” for a satellite, you know?
entry.value: Best guess says the deep space satellite must have sent Timber Hearth some weird pictures, but like… what’s considered “weird” for a satellite, you know?

entry.key: FoundSomething6aAnyway, if you ever want to visit Ol’ Spacey, fastest way is to jump into your ship and use your solar system map to lock on to the satellite, same as you would any astral body.
entry.value: Anyway, if you ever want to visit Ol’ Spacey, fastest way is to jump into your ship and use your solar system map to lock on to the satellite, same as you would any astral body.

entry.key: FoundSomething6bI mean, the satellite’s not super old, but it’s hardly brand-new. “Ol’” is more a term of affection. ...You’re being very literal-minded about this.
entry.value: I mean, the satellite’s not super old, but it’s hardly brand-new. “Ol’” is more a term of affection. ...You’re being very literal-minded about this.

entry.key: FoundSomething6bOl’ Spacey likes visitors, you know! Fastest way to find it is to jump into your ship and use your solar system map to lock on to our faithful satellite friend, same as you would any astral body.
entry.value: Ol’ Spacey likes visitors, you know! Fastest way to find it is to jump into your ship and use your solar system map to lock on to our faithful satellite friend, same as you would any astral body.

entry.key: FoundSomething6cYeah, um, the one that’s standard with all our spacesuits? The one you have with you at all times that opens with the press of a button? …That map?
entry.value: Yeah, um, the one that’s standard with all our spacesuits? The one you have with you at all times that opens with the press of a button? …That map?

entry.key: FoundSomething6cYou didn’t get conked on the head by a rock or a meteorite or something on your way here, did you? No shame in that. Happens to me all the time!
entry.value: You didn’t get conked on the head by a rock or a meteorite or something on your way here, did you? No shame in that. Happens to me all the time!

entry.key: FoundSomething6cIn case you were hit especially hard, don’t forget that you can jump into your ship and use your solar system map to lock on to any astral body. It’s the easiest way to visit Ol’ Spacey, too.
entry.value: In case you were hit especially hard, don’t forget that you can jump into your ship and use your solar system map to lock on to any astral body. It’s the easiest way to visit Ol’ Spacey, too.

entry.value: No worries. Feel free to let me know when you do find something cool, though. You know where to find me.

entry.value: I was hoping you’d be back - something really weird is going on.

entry.value: We’re definitely in a time loop.

entry.value: What did you think it was?

entry.value: Heh, right back at you. Personally, I like new experiences, and I’ve never been in a time loop before.

entry.key: Gabbro3T_4Well. I don’t think I’ve been in a time loop before this one, but then, it’s not like I can know that for sure.

entry.key: Gabbro3T_5I figured it’d be some kind of fidgety time business, but I wasn’t really thinking about what’s happening to the shape of time, you know? But a loop makes sense here. Let’s go with “loop” for now.
entry.value: I figured it’d be some kind of fidgety time business, but I wasn’t really thinking about what’s happening to the shape of time, you know? But a loop makes sense here. Let’s go with “loop” for now.

entry.key: Gabbro3T_6So it looks like you and I are the only ones who know we’re in a time loop. And even if you tell them about it, no one remembers by the next loop. What’s with that?
entry.value: So it looks like you and I are the only ones who know we’re in a time loop. And even if you tell them about it, no one remembers by the next loop. What’s with that?

entry.key: Gabbro3T_6Maybe it’s because we both made some seriously intense eye contact with a Nomai statue?
entry.value: Maybe it’s because we both made some seriously intense eye contact with a Nomai statue?

entry.key: Gabbro3T_6I’m seeing my memories replay each time I die, just like I did when the Nomai statue on the beach opened its eyes and looked at me. So maybe... no glowing statue, no time loop awareness?
entry.value: I’m seeing my memories replay each time I die, just like I did when the Nomai statue on the beach opened its eyes and looked at me. So maybe... no glowing statue, no time loop awareness?

entry.key: Gabbro3T_6I think that’s going to be my leading theory, but if you find out anything new about the statues or the time loop, let me know, okay? I’ll be here.
entry.value: I think that’s going to be my leading theory, but if you find out anything new about the statues or the time loop, let me know, okay? I’ll be here.
