entry.value: PYE: 很可惜，Idaea，我并不认同你的观点。我们正将一种潜在的全新技术发展到前所未有的高度。以我的经验来看，这正是能定义我们这一种族的标志性特点。

entry.key: YARROW: Are there other ways to generate this level of power?
entry.value: YARROW: 还有其他的方法来产生这种程度的能量吗？

entry.key: PYE: Theoretically, yes. Practically, no. I can’t imagine discovering them in our lifetimes...
entry.value: PYE: 理论上存在，但实际上不可能。我不认为我们能在有生之年里发现它们。

entry.key: RAMIE: I understand this proposal is unsettling, but the <color=orange>Sun Station</color> must be built if we hope to complete the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color>.
entry.value: RAMIE: 我理解这一提案令人十分不安，但要想完成<color=orange>灰烬星工程</color>，我们必须建造<color=orange>太阳站</color>。

entry.key: COLEUS: If we fail (and the probability of this is not insignificant), we will without question destroy ourselves, all life here, and the rest of this star system. I wish to protect these species.
entry.value: COLEUS: 如果我们失败了(这一可能性并不小)，我们将毫无疑问毁灭自己和这里的所有生命，还有其余在这个太阳系里的一切。我想要保护这些物种。

entry.key: IDAEA: The potential annihilation of an entire star system is too severe a cost. We shouldn’t build the <color=orange>Sun Station</color>, no matter how badly we want the knowledge that comes with it.
entry.value: IDAEA: 毁灭整个太阳系的潜在风险过于巨大。无论多么迫切希望由此获取知识，我们都不应该改造<color=orange>太阳站</color>。

entry.key: POKE: Fear of failure is a poor reason not to try. I believe, if we’re cautious, the <color=orange>Sun Station</color> will work. I believe in Pye.
entry.value: POKE: 害怕失败并不能作为放弃尝试的充分理由。我相信，只要我们足够谨慎，<color=orange>太阳站</color>将会成功运作。我对Pye的能力有信心。

entry.key: PYE: Poke, I’m deeply honored. Idaea, I comprehend your position; however, if we aren’t all but certain the <color=orange>Sun Station</color> will not cause destruction once we’ve built it, then I won’t support the station’s use.
entry.value: PYE: Poke，我深感荣幸。Idaea，我理解你的立场；但我向你保证，<color=orange>太阳站</color>建造完成后，在我们没有完全确认它是否会造成毁灭之前，我不会支持它的使用。

entry.key: RAMIE: Note: This door will need to remain closed for some time! Pye and I are running an experiment based on the extraordinary findings from the White Hole Station.
entry.value: RAMIE: 注意：这扇门将会保持关闭一阵子！基于在白洞站的异常发现，Pye和我正进行一场实验。

entry.key: PYE: Ramie and I will be running this experiment until one of us (specifically, me) can prove the other wrong, so although it’s inconvenient, the lab currently can only be accessed by the path from the <color=orange>Sunless City</color>.
entry.value: PYE: Ramie和我将持续进行这一实验，直到我们双方其中一个（特别是我）能够证明对方的假设是错的；虽然会造成不便，实验室目前只能从<color=orange>背阴城</color>的道路进入。

entry.key: RAMIE: Inviting sand inside would disrupt our setup and could have enormous consequences. (We realize this is an intriguing prospect, but the door must remain closed nonetheless!)
entry.value: RAMIE: 沙尘漏入会干扰我们的设备并可能造成严重的后果。(我们知道你们对这个实验很感兴趣，但这扇门无论如何必须保持关闭！)

entry.key: RAMIE: An update: The <color=orange>High Energy Lab</color> is now being used to design the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color>! If you’re here to help (or even just to observe), be sure to use the <color=orange>Sunless City</color> path to the lab.
entry.value: RAMIE: 更新：<color=orange>高能实验室</color>现在被用于设计<color=orange>灰烬双星工程</color>！如果你到此来帮忙（或者只是来参观），请使用<color=orange>背阴城</color>的道路进入实验室。

entry.key: RAMIE: The <color=orange>Southern Observatory</color> is asking if creating a 22 minute interval is possible (that is, to have something arrive 22 minutes before it is actually sent through the warp).
entry.value: RAMIE: <color=orange>南部观测站</color>询问产生22分钟的时间差是否可能（也就是说，让物体在实际开始跃迁前的22分钟就到达目的地）.

entry.key: RAMIE: We’ve learned the negative interval of time between departure and arrival can be increased by adding more energy to the warp core. Problematically, the energy required to extend the interval increases at an exponential rate.
entry.value: RAMIE: 我们已知道，离开与到达之间的负时间差可以通过增加对跃迁核心施加的能量来延长。问题是，所需的能量会随着延长的时间长度指数级增大。

entry.key: PYE: Hypothesis: Creating a 22-minute-long interval is possible, but we are currently unable to generate the necessary energy.
entry.value: PYE: 假设：产生22分钟的时间差是可能的，但目前我们无法生成所需的能量

entry.key: PYE: Ramie and I believe it would be necessary to invent a new method of producing energy, a thrilling but enormous undertaking. We would also require advanced warp technology able to handle such energy.
entry.value: PYE: Ramie and I believe it would be necessary to invent a new method of producing energy, a thrilling but enormous undertaking. We would also require advanced warp technology able to handle such energy.

entry.key: PYE: We would also likely need an enormous space to fit these proposed new energy and warp technologies together. The only location large enough would be <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color>.
entry.value: PYE: We would also likely need an enormous space to fit these proposed new energy and warp technologies together. The only location large enough would be <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color>.

entry.key: RAMIE: The energy is currently unavailable, you say? You’re a gas, Pye!
entry.value: RAMIE: The energy is currently unavailable, you say? You’re a gas, Pye!

entry.key: PYE: My pun was unintended, Ramie, so I believe it’s you who’s aeriform!
entry.value: PYE: My pun was unintended, Ramie, so I believe it’s you who’s aeriform!

entry.key: PYE: Records show Nomai arriving at the warp receiver on <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color> very slightly before departing from the <color=orange>White Hole Station</color>. Ramie and I are devising an experiment to test if this is a real phenomenon or simple machine error.
entry.value: PYE: Records show Nomai arriving at the warp receiver on <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color> very slightly before departing from the <color=orange>White Hole Station</color>. Ramie and I are devising an experiment to test if this is a real phenomenon or simple machine error.

entry.key: RAMIE: In theory, what we want to try to reproduce is a negative amount of time elapsing between something entering the black hole and exiting the white hole at its destination.
entry.value: RAMIE: In theory, what we want to try to reproduce is a negative amount of time elapsing between something entering the black hole and exiting the white hole at its destination.

entry.key: PYE: Initial things first: Our experiment setup will first pair a small black hole core with a small white hole core to mimic the setup on the <color=orange>White Hole Station</color>.
entry.value: PYE: Initial things first: Our experiment setup will first pair a small black hole core with a small white hole core to mimic the setup on the <color=orange>White Hole Station</color>.

entry.key: RAMIE: Hypothesis: It is possible for an object to exit a white hole before entering the corresponding black hole.
entry.value: RAMIE: Hypothesis: It is possible for an object to exit a white hole before entering the corresponding black hole.

entry.key: RAMIE: An update: Our experiment here reproduced the anomaly in arrival and departure times, but Pye is unconvinced it’s more than an equipment error. I hope to strengthen the effect to render it visible to the unaided eyes.
entry.value: RAMIE: An update: Our experiment here reproduced the anomaly in arrival and departure times, but Pye is unconvinced it’s more than an equipment error. I hope to strengthen the effect to render it visible to the unaided eyes.

entry.key: PYE: To that end, we’ve decided to try adding more energy. I imagine the <color=orange>Sunless City</color>’s energy supply should prove sufficient.
entry.value: PYE: To that end, we’ve decided to try adding more energy. I imagine the <color=orange>Sunless City</color>’s energy supply should prove sufficient.

entry.key: PYE: Of note, Ramie: Yarrow requests that we let him know before we reroute energy to the experiment.
entry.value: PYE: Of note, Ramie: Yarrow requests that we let him know before we reroute energy to the experiment.

entry.key: RAMIE: I’d hate to leave him in the dark!
entry.value: RAMIE: I’d hate to leave him in the dark!

entry.key: PYE: All available energy has been rerouted from the city to our experiment. Ramie and I are about to run a new test.
entry.value: PYE: All available energy has been rerouted from the city to our experiment. Ramie and I are about to run a new test.

entry.key: RAMIE: Hypothesis confirmed! Hypothesis confirmed! I saw it! Pye saw it! Hypothesis confirmed!
entry.value: RAMIE: Hypothesis confirmed! Hypothesis confirmed! I saw it! Pye saw it! Hypothesis confirmed!

entry.key: PYE: This is beyond extraordinary! This changes everything! What a beautiful day for the intersection of abstract theory and practical application!
entry.value: PYE: This is beyond extraordinary! This changes everything! What a beautiful day for the intersection of abstract theory and practical application!

entry.key: SECCA: Our <color=orange>escape pod</color> crashed as we tried to flee this place, destroying our movement and communication capabilities in the process.
entry.value: SECCA: Our <color=orange>escape pod</color> crashed as we tried to flee this place, destroying our movement and communication capabilities in the process.

entry.key: SECCA: We’ve held out as long as we could here, but this pod’s supply of breathable air is nearly depleted, and the anglerfish attack more and more frequently.
entry.value: SECCA: We’ve held out as long as we could here, but this pod’s supply of breathable air is nearly depleted, and the anglerfish attack more and more frequently.

entry.key: SECCA: Our best chance at survival is to return to the <color=orange>Vessel</color> to either repair the damage or, more probably, await rescue.
entry.value: SECCA: Our best chance at survival is to return to the <color=orange>Vessel</color> to either repair the damage or, more probably, await rescue.

entry.key: ESCALL: Secca, is the message finished? The <color=orange>Vessel</color>’s beacon is already growing fainter; it will be gone in a matter of hours. We need to leave here, quickly.
entry.value: ESCALL: Secca, is the message finished? The <color=orange>Vessel</color>’s beacon is already growing fainter; it will be gone in a matter of hours. We need to leave here, quickly.

entry.key: CANNA: To any Nomai clans whose Vessels can hear this message:
entry.value: CANNA: To any Nomai clans whose Vessels can hear this message:

entry.key: CANNA: It’s clear the universe is dying. There are fewer and fewer resources and safe places within space now, so my clan and I believe the best option is for all of our clans to stay together.
entry.value: CANNA: It’s clear the universe is dying. There are fewer and fewer resources and safe places within space now, so my clan and I believe the best option is for all of our clans to stay together.

entry.key: CANNA: If you can reach the Gloaming Galaxy, we’ve found that Blackrock’s suns are fairly stable, and life in this star system is (comparatively) thriving. We live in relative safety.
entry.value: CANNA: If you can reach the Gloaming Galaxy, we’ve found that Blackrock’s suns are fairly stable, and life in this star system is (comparatively) thriving. We live in relative safety.

entry.key: CANNA: If you prefer to continue exploring alone, know you will be on your own.
entry.value: CANNA: If you prefer to continue exploring alone, know you will be on your own.

entry.key: BROMI: Canna, we’re making our way to you.
entry.value: BROMI: Canna, we’re making our way to you.

entry.key: CANNA: It’s good to hear from you, Bromi! We’ll watch for your Vessel.
entry.value: CANNA: It’s good to hear from you, Bromi! We’ll watch for your Vessel.

entry.key: CANNA: Has anyone heard from Neem? His clan was on its way to our Vessel, but they never arrived, and he hasn’t sent any messages. I’m beginning to worry.
entry.value: CANNA: Has anyone heard from Neem? His clan was on its way to our Vessel, but they never arrived, and he hasn’t sent any messages. I’m beginning to worry.

entry.key: BROMI: That is unsettling. It reminds me of that old myth my grandfather used to tell, the Disappearance of Escall.
entry.value: BROMI: That is unsettling. It reminds me of that old myth my grandfather used to tell, the Disappearance of Escall.

entry.key: CLEM: I remember hearing that story as a child! One day, Escall’s <color=orange>Vessel</color> simply stopped responding. The other clans searched and searched, but found no trace. It was as if their missing friends had warped out of existence.
entry.value: CLEM: I remember hearing that story as a child! One day, Escall’s <color=orange>Vessel</color> simply stopped responding. The other clans searched and searched, but found no trace. It was as if their missing friends had warped out of existence.

entry.key: HYSSOP: That’s no myth, friends; Escall’s clan existed, and their story was real.
entry.value: HYSSOP: That’s no myth, friends; Escall’s clan existed, and their story was real.

entry.key: BROMI: What a curious event to have passed into myth! Our ancestors’ ancestors were told that story when they were young. Are you sure it’s true, Hyssop?
entry.value: BROMI: What a curious event to have passed into myth! Our ancestors’ ancestors were told that story when they were young. Are you sure it’s true, Hyssop?

entry.key: HYSSOP: It was a very long time ago, but yes. My clan’s ancestors searched for Escall’s clan for a long time, but in the end, none of them were ever seen again. (It’s the only time in our history a Vessel has ever disappeared this way.)
entry.value: HYSSOP: It was a very long time ago, but yes. My clan’s ancestors searched for Escall’s clan for a long time, but in the end, none of them were ever seen again. (It’s the only time in our history a Vessel has ever disappeared this way.)

entry.key: NEEM: Hyssop, I hope you aren’t comparing Escall’s story to my clan’s Vessel!
entry.value: NEEM: Hyssop, I hope you aren’t comparing Escall’s story to my clan’s Vessel!

entry.key: CLEM: Neem, my friend! We feared you were gone!
entry.value: CLEM: Neem, my friend! We feared you were gone!

entry.key: NEEM: Not yet, we aren’t, but nearly. We found trouble during our warp: The triple suns of the Bright Spark star system exploded, and it was only a lucky coincidence we weren’t caught in the blast. We’ll meet you soon, Canna!
entry.value: NEEM: Not yet, we aren’t, but nearly. We found trouble during our warp: The triple suns of the Bright Spark star system exploded, and it was only a lucky coincidence we weren’t caught in the blast. We’ll meet you soon, Canna!

entry.key: CANNA: I’m relieved your clan is safe, Neem! It’s good to hear your words. Any Vessels nearby, remember to be extremely cautious of potentially unstable stars (which is most of them, now).
entry.value: CANNA: I’m relieved your clan is safe, Neem! It’s good to hear your words. Any Vessels nearby, remember to be extremely cautious of potentially unstable stars (which is most of them, now).

entry.key: FILIX: This is Escall’s <color=orange>Vessel</color>; something went badly wrong during our warp, and our <color=orange>Vessel</color> is mortally wounded. We need help as quickly as possible!
entry.value: FILIX: This is Escall’s <color=orange>Vessel</color>; something went badly wrong during our warp, and our <color=orange>Vessel</color> is mortally wounded. We need help as quickly as possible!

entry.key: FILIX: Our Vessel appears to have... has it fused with the local environment, somehow? There are vines that are now part of the Vessel! It’s been torn apart from inside itself!
entry.value: FILIX: Our Vessel appears to have... has it fused with the local environment, somehow? There are vines that are now part of the Vessel! It’s been torn apart from inside itself!

entry.key: FILIX: We... we are abandoning our <color=orange>Vessel</color>. Any Nomai clans or spaceflight-capable species receiving this message, I implore you, we need your help!
entry.value: FILIX: We... we are abandoning our <color=orange>Vessel</color>. Any Nomai clans or spaceflight-capable species receiving this message, I implore you, we need your help!

entry.key: FILIX: Is this broken? Can anyone hear me? Our <color=orange>Vessel</color> is dying! We need immediate assistance!
entry.value: FILIX: Is this broken? Can anyone hear me? Our <color=orange>Vessel</color> is dying! We need immediate assistance!

entry.key: FILIX: I’m recording now — I’ve never encountered anything like this! The signal the Vessel is receiving appears to be older than the universe itself!
entry.value: FILIX: I’m recording now — I’ve never encountered anything like this! The signal the Vessel is receiving appears to be older than the universe itself!

entry.key: ESCALL: This is our first contact with anything of this nature. Everyone, prepare to warp immediately!
entry.value: ESCALL: This is our first contact with anything of this nature. Everyone, prepare to warp immediately!

entry.key: FILIX: Escall, wait, I need more time to send an outgoing message! Shouldn’t we tell another clan where we’re going?
entry.value: FILIX: Escall, wait, I need more time to send an outgoing message! Shouldn’t we tell another clan where we’re going?

entry.key: ESCALL: We can send the message upon our arrival. This extraordinary signal appeared suddenly; it may disappear just as quickly, and we can’t lose a discovery this incredible! Focus on preparing for the warp, instead.
entry.value: ESCALL: We can send the message upon our arrival. This extraordinary signal appeared suddenly; it may disappear just as quickly, and we can’t lose a discovery this incredible! Focus on preparing for the warp, instead.

entry.key: FILIX: I understand!
entry.value: FILIX: I understand!

entry.key: ESCALL: Annona, is the <color=orange>Vessel</color> ready to warp to the signal’s approximate coordinates?
entry.value: ESCALL: Annona, is the <color=orange>Vessel</color> ready to warp to the signal’s approximate coordinates?

entry.key: ANNONA: The warp core is powered, but this will be a significant jump. Afterward, we’ll need time to recharge the core.
entry.value: ANNONA: The warp core is powered, but this will be a significant jump. Afterward, we’ll need time to recharge the core.

entry.key: ESCALL: That shouldn’t create a problem, provided we arrive at or near the signal’s source. Everyone, we’re ready to warp!
entry.value: ESCALL: That shouldn’t create a problem, provided we arrive at or near the signal’s source. Everyone, we’re ready to warp!

entry.key: CASSAVA: This is it: We’ve finished building the final <color=orange>Orbital Probe Cannon</color> module and are ready to send it into orbit around <color=lightblue>Giant’s Deep</color> for assembly!
entry.value: CASSAVA: This is it: We’ve finished building the final <color=orange>Orbital Probe Cannon</color> module and are ready to send it into orbit around <color=lightblue>Giant’s Deep</color> for assembly!

entry.key: CASSAVA: To all my friends here at the <color=orange>Construction Yard</color>, my gratitude for your tireless work. I had given up hope, but I truly believe this cannon may actually succeed where many other attempts have not.
entry.value: CASSAVA: To all my friends here at the <color=orange>Construction Yard</color>, my gratitude for your tireless work. I had given up hope, but I truly believe this cannon may actually succeed where many other attempts have not.

entry.key: DAZ: Are you going gelatinous on us, love? I’m delighted by your words, but they’re atypical for you!
entry.value: DAZ: Are you going gelatinous on us, love? I’m delighted by your words, but they’re atypical for you!

entry.key: CASSAVA: If I’m ever half as gooey as Mallow and Avens behave together, Daz, you may launch me from the Orbital Probe Cannon.
entry.value: CASSAVA: If I’m ever half as gooey as Mallow and Avens behave together, Daz, you may launch me from the Orbital Probe Cannon.

entry.key: CASSAVA: Our next step will be to send Privet up to the <color=orange>Orbital Probe Cannon</color> to install the probe tracking system.
entry.value: CASSAVA: Our next step will be to send Privet up to the <color=orange>Orbital Probe Cannon</color> to install the probe tracking system.

entry.key: DAZ: If I know my brother, Avens (and his spouse) will want to launch the probe with as much power as possible. I’m worried the cannon would break under the strain.
entry.value: DAZ: If I know my brother, Avens (and his spouse) will want to launch the probe with as much power as possible. I’m worried the cannon would break under the strain.

entry.key: DAZ: I propose we give Avens and Mallow a slightly lower maximum power setting than the absolute maximum possible to create room for their enthusiasm.
entry.value: DAZ: I propose we give Avens and Mallow a slightly lower maximum power setting than the absolute maximum possible to create room for their enthusiasm.

entry.key: Be welcomed in this place. This tower shares with all who ask the knowledge needed to make his or her first quantum journey.
entry.value: 欢迎来到这里。这座塔将向任何踏上他或她的第一次量子之旅的人分享需要的知识。

entry.key: Enter this place without friends, however; these are lessons to learn for yourself.
entry.value: 但是，请一个人进入这里；这些课程需要你独自学习。

entry.key: Seek the wandering arch.
entry.value: 找寻游荡的的拱门。

entry.key: Observing a quantum object; observing an image of a quantum object. These are the same.
entry.value: 观察一个量子物体与观察它的图像是一样的。

entry.key: This is the last one (but we made it harder).
entry.value: 这是最后一个试炼（但我们把它做的更难了）。

entry.key: LAMI: They’re going to test the memory statues tonight! Phlox says it could be dangerous, so we can’t come.
entry.value: LAMI: They’re going to test the memory statues tonight! Phlox says it could be dangerous, so we can’t come.

entry.key: LAMI: But, what if we didn’t use the door and snuck in the other way? Does anyone want to?
entry.value: LAMI: But, what if we didn’t use the door and snuck in the other way? Does anyone want to?

entry.key: TAGET: Phlox specifically told us not to do that.
entry.value: TAGET: Phlox specifically told us not to do that.

entry.key: LAEVI: I really want to see the test, too, Lami, but that’s a huge risk to take. We probably shouldn’t. Maybe Phlox’ll let us see a later test.
entry.value: LAEVI: I really want to see the test, too, Lami, but that’s a huge risk to take. We probably shouldn’t. Maybe Phlox’ll let us see a later test.

entry.key: <color=orange>Statue Workshop</color>
entry.value: <color=orange>雕像工坊</color>

entry.key: SOLANUM: I am here! After watching it wander the skies for so long, I am about to stand (for the first time) on the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>.
entry.value: SOLANUM: I am here! After watching it wander the skies for so long, I am about to stand (for the first time) on the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>.

entry.key: SOLANUM: As expected, my <color=orange>shuttle</color> has landed at the moon’s south pole. I will make the remainder of my journey on foot.
entry.value: SOLANUM: As expected, my <color=orange>shuttle</color> has landed at the moon’s south pole. I will make the remainder of my journey on foot.

entry.key: SOLANUM: We don’t know why the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> always welcomes its visitors at the south pole, just that this is true.
entry.value: SOLANUM: We don’t know why the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> always welcomes its visitors at the south pole, just that this is true.

entry.key: SOLANUM: As a child, I considered such unknowns sinister. Now, though, I understand they bear no ill will. The universe is, and we are.
entry.value: SOLANUM: As a child, I considered such unknowns sinister. Now, though, I understand they bear no ill will. The universe is, and we are.

entry.key: SOLANUM: I am ready.
entry.value: SOLANUM: I am ready.

entry.key: WARNING: Opens emergency door.
entry.value: 警告：打开应急门。

entry.key: PYE: Mission: Science compels us to explode the <color=lightblue>sun</color>!
entry.value: PYE: 任务：为了科学我们必须炸掉<color=lightblue>太阳</color>！

entry.key: IDAEA: Here’s a better one. Mission: Determine if it’s possible to prompt the <color=lightblue>sun</color> to explode.
entry.value: IDAEA: 还是这样说好些。任务: 确认是否可能引爆<color=lightblue>太阳</color>。

entry.key: IDAEA: Can’t we change this? I don’t enjoy working in view of such a morbid mission statement.
entry.value: IDAEA: 能不能改改？我可不想在这样病态的任务说明下工作。

entry.key: PYE: But it’s accurate. We’re going to create a supernova for the purpose of scientific progress. That’s our mission.
entry.value: PYE: 但这很准确。我们要为了科学进展的目的创造一颗超新星。这正是我们的任务。

entry.key: IDAEA: Our mission is to decide if such an irresponsible feat is even possible.
entry.value: IDAEA: 我们的任务是确认这样这种不负责任的壮举是否可能实现。

entry.key: PYE: You lack a sense of humor.
entry.value: PYE: 你缺少幽默感。

entry.key: IDAEA: At least I don’t lack a sense of ethics!
entry.value: IDAEA: 至少我不缺少道德感！

entry.key: PYE: Kindly refrain from going supernova on me before the <color=lightblue>sun</color> does, Idaea.
entry.value: PYE: Idaea，请你别在<color=lightblue>太阳</color>爆炸前就先在我面前变成超新星爆发了。

entry.key: THATCH: Where should this new, more sophisticated locator be built? It may need to be larger than this <color=orange>Eye signal locator</color> is.
entry.value: THATCH: Where should this new, more sophisticated locator be built? It may need to be larger than this <color=orange>Eye signal locator</color> is.

entry.key: PLUME: The southern glacier on <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color> has ample available space. I could construct a new building to house this proposed locator.
entry.value: PLUME: The southern glacier on <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color> has ample available space. I could construct a new building to house this proposed locator.

entry.key: FILIX: Yes, let’s build there! I imagine our young friend Conoy would enjoy that immensely. He’s always held a great interest in the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>, especially for a child born so long after the crash.
entry.value: FILIX: Yes, let’s build there! I imagine our young friend Conoy would enjoy that immensely. He’s always held a great interest in the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>, especially for a child born so long after the crash.

entry.key: PLUME: I will begin construction on <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color>’s south pole immediately, then!
entry.value: PLUME: I will begin construction on <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color>’s south pole immediately, then!

entry.key: COLEUS: Annona and those of us originally stranded on <color=lightblue>Ember Twin</color> built a <color=orange>Quantum Moon locator</color> there, but the heat of the <color=lightblue>sun</color> made its construction challenging. I wouldn’t recommend building on that planet.
entry.value: COLEUS: Annona and those of us originally stranded on <color=lightblue>Ember Twin</color> built a <color=orange>Quantum Moon locator</color> there, but the heat of the <color=lightblue>sun</color> made its construction challenging. I wouldn’t recommend building on that planet.

entry.key: COLEUS: After closer observation, mining site 2a wouldn’t be safe for the native life dwelling in some of this cave’s pools, so (unfortunately) we’ll have to mine one of the other sites.
entry.value: COLEUS: After closer observation, mining site 2a wouldn’t be safe for the native life dwelling in some of this cave’s pools, so (unfortunately) we’ll have to mine one of the other sites.

entry.key: COLEUS: On the opposite hand, new life! This species is semi-aquatic, and very hardy. The ecosystem here is quite robust, so I believe they’ll thrive in the long run. Be cautious near the pools if you visit 2a to meet them.
entry.value: COLEUS: On the opposite hand, new life! This species is semi-aquatic, and very hardy. The ecosystem here is quite robust, so I believe they’ll thrive in the long run. Be cautious near the pools if you visit 2a to meet them.

entry.key: CYCAD: There are a few other cave sites that look promising. What about site 2b (it shares similar formations and strata)?
entry.value: CYCAD: There are a few other cave sites that look promising. What about site 2b (it shares similar formations and strata)?

entry.key: OENO: This sounds promising! Will you and your mentor investigate? If mining site 2b proves safe for this native species, we’ll move our work there.
entry.value: OENO: This sounds promising! Will you and your mentor investigate? If mining site 2b proves safe for this native species, we’ll move our work there.

entry.key: CYCAD: Site 2b is safe! Coleus says we’ll continue to monitor our activity and its effect on life here.
entry.value: CYCAD: Site 2b is safe! Coleus says we’ll continue to monitor our activity and its effect on life here.

entry.key: CYCAD: I was watching them once during a rest, and the hours escaped from me. They’re fascinating (I wonder what their fourth eye does)!
entry.value: CYCAD: I was watching them once during a rest, and the hours escaped from me. They’re fascinating (I wonder what their fourth eye does)!

entry.key: COLEUS: They remind me of a subterranean species that my mentor, Melorae, once told me about (from when our clan used to travel across this universe). I imagine she would have enjoyed these lifeforms greatly.
entry.value: COLEUS: They remind me of a subterranean species that my mentor, Melorae, once told me about (from when our clan used to travel across this universe). I imagine she would have enjoyed these lifeforms greatly.

entry.key: CASSAVA: We’re nearly ready! Filix and I have finished construction, and she says calibrating the device won’t take long.
entry.value: CASSAVA: We’re nearly ready! Filix and I have finished construction, and she says calibrating the device won’t take long.

entry.key: FILIX: Fortunately, the <color=lightblue>Attlerock</color>’s lack of atmosphere will make calibration simple. After all this time, I’m thrilled to finally resume our search!
entry.value: FILIX: Fortunately, the <color=lightblue>Attlerock</color>’s lack of atmosphere will make calibration simple. After all this time, I’m thrilled to finally resume our search!

entry.key: Caution: You are about to access the core while the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color> is active.
entry.value: 注意：你将在<color=orange>灰烬星工程</color>处于激活状态时接近核心

entry.key: WARNING: Removing the core will disable the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color>.
entry.value: 警告：移除核心将会关停<color=orange>灰烬星工程</color>。

entry.key: Artificial gravity control
entry.value: 人工重力开关

entry.key: YARROW: Today we finished the excavation of <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color>. Here, in this space we carved, we will craft our most ambitious project yet: the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color>, powerful enough to send information back in time.
entry.value: YARROW: Today we finished the excavation of <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color>. Here, in this space we carved, we will craft our most ambitious project yet: the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color>, powerful enough to send information back in time.

entry.key: COLEUS: We’ve also finished relocating all subterranean plants we met while digging.
entry.value: COLEUS: We’ve also finished relocating all subterranean plants we met while digging.

entry.key: RAMIE: We’ll need to keep our eyes on how significantly we’ve altered the environment here.
entry.value: RAMIE: We’ll need to keep our eyes on how significantly we’ve altered the environment here.

entry.key: PYE: How far we’ve come since our experiments at the <color=orange>High Energy Lab</color>! I still can hardly believe Ramie’s hypothesis was true.
entry.value: PYE: How far we’ve come since our experiments at the <color=orange>High Energy Lab</color>! I still can hardly believe Ramie’s hypothesis was true.

entry.key: YARROW: Poke just sent the warp core for the final tower to us from the <color=orange>Black Hole Forge</color>. Now <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color> can be connected with <color=lightblue>Giant’s Deep</color>, where Cassava is working with Avens to craft the <color=orange>Orbital Probe Cannon</color>, and where Phlox is sculpting the memory statues.
entry.value: YARROW: Poke just sent the warp core for the final tower to us from the <color=orange>Black Hole Forge</color>. Now <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color> can be connected with <color=lightblue>Giant’s Deep</color>, where Cassava is working with Avens to craft the <color=orange>Orbital Probe Cannon</color>, and where Phlox is sculpting the memory statues.

entry.key: CASSAVA: Hypothesis: It was not by accident the core of our warp tower was the last to be forged.
entry.value: CASSAVA: Hypothesis: It was not by accident the core of our warp tower was the last to be forged.

entry.key: POKE: Hypothesis: The cores could have been forged faster if Cassava had interrupted my work less frequently to ask for updates.
entry.value: POKE: Hypothesis: The cores could have been forged faster if Cassava had interrupted my work less frequently to ask for updates.

entry.key: YARROW: The important point is we are all connected through <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color> now, and also that I’m no longer needed for mediating your disagreements.
entry.value: YARROW: The important point is we are all connected through <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color> now, and also that I’m no longer needed for mediating your disagreements.

entry.key: YARROW: Our friends on <color=lightblue>Giant’s Deep</color> tested the <color=orange>Orbital Probe Cannon</color> today. Mallow tells me the cannon is doing well, and that Avens advocates for more launch power. If anyone can coax the maximum power from a device, Avens can.
entry.value: YARROW: Our friends on <color=lightblue>Giant’s Deep</color> tested the <color=orange>Orbital Probe Cannon</color> today. Mallow tells me the cannon is doing well, and that Avens advocates for more launch power. If anyone can coax the maximum power from a device, Avens can.

entry.key: YARROW: But then, if anyone can goad a device into exploding, that, too, is likely Avens. Perhaps I should check in with the <color=orange>Orbital Probe Cannon</color> crew in the interest of safety.
entry.value: YARROW: But then, if anyone can goad a device into exploding, that, too, is likely Avens. Perhaps I should check in with the <color=orange>Orbital Probe Cannon</color> crew in the interest of safety.

entry.key: YARROW: Would it help to remind Avens that Mallow (his love) will be one of the Nomai aboard the cannon, or is Mallow part of the problem?
entry.value: YARROW: Would it help to remind Avens that Mallow (his love) will be one of the Nomai aboard the cannon, or is Mallow part of the problem?

entry.key: YARROW: Pye and Idaea have worked hard on the <color=orange>Sun Station</color>, and it at last is complete. If everything goes as planned, this structure will prompt the <color=lightblue>sun</color>’s explosion, which will in turn supply the power the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color> requires.
entry.value: YARROW: Pye and Idaea have worked hard on the <color=orange>Sun Station</color>, and it at last is complete. If everything goes as planned, this structure will prompt the <color=lightblue>sun</color>’s explosion, which will in turn supply the power the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color> requires.

entry.key: RAMIE: I’m impressed by their mental fortitude. This was the project’s most difficult task, in more ways than one.
entry.value: RAMIE: I’m impressed by their mental fortitude. This was the project’s most difficult task, in more ways than one.

entry.key: YARROW: We’re nearly ready to activate the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color>! Here is what will happen: First, the <color=orange>Sun Station</color> will receive the order to fire at the <color=lightblue>sun</color>, prompting it to explode.
entry.value: YARROW: We’re nearly ready to activate the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color>! Here is what will happen: First, the <color=orange>Sun Station</color> will receive the order to fire at the <color=lightblue>sun</color>, prompting it to explode.

entry.key: YARROW: Using the energy from the resulting supernova, the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color> will send the order for the <color=orange>Orbital Probe Cannon</color> to fire back in time by 22 minutes.
entry.value: YARROW: Using the energy from the resulting supernova, the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color> will send the order for the <color=orange>Orbital Probe Cannon</color> to fire back in time by 22 minutes.

entry.key: YARROW: Exactly 22 minutes after these orders are received, the <color=orange>Sun Station</color> will again trigger the supernova to send the probe data from this cannon launch back in time.
entry.value: YARROW: Exactly 22 minutes after these orders are received, the <color=orange>Sun Station</color> will again trigger the supernova to send the probe data from this cannon launch back in time.

entry.key: YARROW: In total, each cycle created by the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color> will last precisely 22 minutes. We can end this cycle at will.
entry.value: YARROW: In total, each cycle created by the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color> will last precisely 22 minutes. We can end this cycle at will.

entry.key: YARROW: These words are difficult to write: The <color=orange>Sun Station</color> did not work.
entry.value: YARROW: These words are difficult to write: The <color=orange>Sun Station</color> did not work.

entry.key: YARROW: However, this is the closest we have ever been. The <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color> is theoretically sound; we were only unable to power it. Perhaps there is another way.
entry.value: YARROW: However, this is the closest we have ever been. The <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color> is theoretically sound; we were only unable to power it. Perhaps there is another way.

entry.key: PYE: Suppose we redesign the <color=orange>Sun Station</color>. To generate power of that magnitude, a supernova is still our only viable option.
entry.value: PYE: Suppose we redesign the <color=orange>Sun Station</color>. To generate power of that magnitude, a supernova is still our only viable option.

entry.key: IDAEA: This is easier expressed than accomplished.
entry.value: IDAEA: This is easier expressed than accomplished.

entry.key: PYE: You can wait for the <color=lightblue>sun</color> to explode on its natural timeline if you prefer, Idaea, but you’ll need to find some way to halt our aging process.
entry.value: PYE: You can wait for the <color=lightblue>sun</color> to explode on its natural timeline if you prefer, Idaea, but you’ll need to find some way to halt our aging process.

entry.key: RAMIE: I believe we can still find a way to create a supernova, my friend. Don’t lose hope!
entry.value: RAMIE: I believe we can still find a way to create a supernova, my friend. Don’t lose hope!

entry.key: YARROW: We are halting our research into creating a supernova for this moment; a <color=lightblue>comet</color> has newly arrived in this solar system, and we’re anxious to explore it.
entry.value: YARROW: We are halting our research into creating a supernova for this moment; a <color=lightblue>comet</color> has newly arrived in this solar system, and we’re anxious to explore it.

entry.key: YARROW: It’s been a very long time since we last explored somewhere new, so we’re excited to welcome this <color=lightblue>comet</color>. Imagine what knowledge might be gained there!
entry.value: YARROW: It’s been a very long time since we last explored somewhere new, so we’re excited to welcome this <color=lightblue>comet</color>. Imagine what knowledge might be gained there!

entry.key: PYE: Friends visiting from the <color=orange>Hanging City</color>, we are planning the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color> at the <color=orange>High Energy Lab</color> on <color=lightblue>Ember Twin</color>’s equator.
entry.value: PYE: Friends visiting from the <color=orange>Hanging City</color>, we are planning the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color> at the <color=orange>High Energy Lab</color> on <color=lightblue>Ember Twin</color>’s equator.

entry.key: CONOY: I became lost on <color=lightblue>Ember Twin</color> (my gratitude that Ramie found me!), but the <color=orange>High Energy Lab</color> is the building with the large solar panels. I’m suprised I didn’t see it!
entry.value: CONOY: I became lost on <color=lightblue>Ember Twin</color> (my gratitude that Ramie found me!), but the <color=orange>High Energy Lab</color> is the building with the large solar panels. I’m suprised I didn’t see it!

entry.key: RAMIE: I imagine our otherwise immensely clever Conoy would lose his own head if it weren’t anatomically impossible!
entry.value: RAMIE: I imagine our otherwise immensely clever Conoy would lose his own head if it weren’t anatomically impossible!

entry.key: The <color=orange>shuttle</color> is currently resting at the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>.
entry.value: <color=orange>穿梭机</color>目前停泊在<color=lightblue>量子卫星</color>。

entry.key: What is the <color=lightblue>Eye of the universe</color>?
entry.value: <color=lightblue>宇宙之眼</color>是什么？

entry.key: The <color=lightblue>Eye</color> is the source of the signal that brought us here.
entry.value: <color=lightblue>眼</color>是引导我们到这里的信号源。

entry.key: Suppose the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> is a more advanced being.
entry.value: 也许<color=lightblue>眼</color>是一个更高等的存在。

entry.key: The <color=lightblue>Eye</color> is older than this universe, so imagine how much it could teach us.
entry.value: <color=lightblue>眼</color>比这个宇宙还要古老，所以可以想象它能够教给我们多少知识。

entry.key: Perhaps it is a cosmic library!
entry.value: 也许它是一个宇宙图书馆！

entry.key: What is the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>’s signal?
entry.value: <color=lightblue>宇宙之眼</color>的信号是什么？

entry.key: Suppose the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> wishes to communicate.
entry.value: 也许<color=lightblue>眼</color>想要交流。

entry.key: The signal is a call. Were we the intended audience?
entry.value: 信号是一个召唤。它是在召唤我们吗？

entry.key: The signal is the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>’s voice. It speaks a language we don’t yet know.
entry.value: 信号是<color=lightblue>眼</color>声音。它说着我们未知的语言。

entry.key: Or maybe the signal is the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>’s attempt at expressing itself.
entry.value: 又或许信号是<color=lightblue>眼</color>尝试表现自己的方式。

entry.key: Of note: From the signal, we were able to determine the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>’s approximate age (or perhaps its lack of age?).
entry.value: 重要的是：分析信号，我们能够确定<color=lightblue>眼</color>的大致年龄（或者它并不存在年龄？）。

entry.key: Be welcomed in this place. This shrine is a space to reflect on what brought us to this star system: the signal from the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>.
entry.value: 欢迎来到这里。这座圣堂是用于思考引导我们到这个太阳系的<color=lightblue>眼</color>的信号的地方。

entry.key: We observed the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>’s signal in our travels, and followed it here to find its source.
entry.value: 我们旅行中观测到<color=lightblue>眼</color>的信号，并为了找到它的源头而跟随它到了这里。

entry.key: What we know is this: The source of the signal (which we have chosen to call the <color=lightblue>Eye of the universe</color>) is older than this universe itself. The rest, we have yet to learn.
entry.value: 我们所知道的是：信号的源头（我们将其称作<color=lightblue>宇宙之眼</color>）比这个宇宙本身更古老。其余的，我们还尚不知道。

entry.key: Enter, and open your mind to its possibilities.
entry.value: 进入此地，开放头脑去思考它的无限可能。

entry.key: Solution 1: We could retrieve the warp core from the <color=orange>Vessel</color>.
entry.value: 解决方案1: 我们可以从<color=orange>母舰</color>那里取回跃迁核心。

entry.key: RAMIE: The <color=orange>Vessel</color>’s warp core is broken, at best (recall those present when the <color=orange>Vessel</color> crashed said it sustained lethal injuries). There is no guaranteed reward for this risk.
entry.value: RAMIE: <color=orange>母舰</color>的核心很大可能已经损坏(我想起当时经历过<color=orange>母舰</color>坠毁的人说它受到了致命的损伤)。 这样冒险也可能将一无所获。

entry.key: CONOY: Perhaps we could still repair it. My grandmother told me there was little time to assess the nature or extent of the damage.
entry.value: CONOY: 也许我们还能修复它。我的祖母告诉我当时时间紧迫，来不及确认损伤的原因或程度。

entry.key: CASSAVA: Even if it no longer functions, the old core could be a valuable blueprint, provided we’re able to transport it back here.
entry.value: CASSAVA: 即使它已不能使用，旧核心也可能是一个宝贵的蓝图，前提是我们能它运回到这里。

entry.key: PHLOX: This would require a return to <color=lightblue>Dark Bramble</color>. Plume (my father) said many good Nomai perished there.
entry.value: PHLOX: 那样就需要我们回到<color=lightblue>黑棘星</color>。Plume（我的父亲）说过很多优秀的\\nNomai人都在那里失去了生命。

entry.key: CYCAD: My mentor (Coleus) and his old mentor once discovered and studied an anglerfish fossil on <color=lightblue>Ember Twin</color>. Using that knowledge, we could avoid the anglerfish entirely!
entry.value: CYCAD: 我的导师（Coleus）和他从前的导师在<color=lightblue>灰烬星</color>发现并研究过一具鮟鱇鱼化石。用他们研究所得的知识，我们完全可以避开鮟鱇鱼！

entry.key: COLEUS: What Melorae and I learned from that fossil would theoretically help us evade the anglerfish, but our hypothesis was never tested on a live specimen.
entry.value: COLEUS: Melorae和我从那具化石上得到的知识理论上能够帮助我们避开鮟鱇鱼，但我们的假说从未在活体样本上进行过验证。

entry.key: RAMIE: I remember that anglerfish fossil! We used to play in <color=orange>Fossil Fish Cave</color> when we were children.
entry.value: RAMIE: 我记得那具鮟鱇鱼化石！我们小时候曾在<color=orange>鱼化石洞穴</color>里玩耍过。

entry.key: SOLANUM: I no longer believe, as I did as a child on <color=lightblue>Ember Twin</color>, that the <color=lightblue>Eye of the universe</color> (the source of the signal) wishes to harm us. But it may not want to be found, either.
entry.value: SOLANUM: 我已不再像儿时在<color=lightblue>灰烬星</color>上那样认为<color=lightblue>宇宙之眼</color>（信号的源头）想要伤害我们。但它也可能并不希望被找到。

entry.key: SOLANUM: The terrible circumstances of our arrival here were almost certainly exactly that: circumstance.
entry.value: SOLANUM: 我们来到这里时遭遇的可怕情况几乎可以肯定正是那样的情况。

entry.key: SOLANUM: I suspect imagining we are special to the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> in some way is wishful thinking. The <color=lightblue>Eye</color> might have called out to any sentient species.
entry.value: SOLANUM: 我怀疑我们不过是在一厢情愿地想象自己在某方面对<color=lightblue>眼</color>而言有所特殊。<color=lightblue>眼</color>有可能只是在呼唤所有智慧物种。

entry.key: SOLANUM: Or it might not have been calling out at all, and that my ancestors heard the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>’s signal holds no great, deep meaning.
entry.value: SOLANUM: 或者它根本就不是在呼唤，而我的祖辈们所听到的<color=lightblue>眼</color>的信号并没有什么重要和深刻的意义。

entry.key: SOLANUM: This wouldn’t be so bad, I think.
entry.value: SOLANUM: 我想，这样的话也不是一件坏事。

entry.key: SOLANUM: In fact, the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> may not have wishes at all. We have no evidence supporting this.
entry.value: SOLANUM: 事实上，<color=lightblue>眼</color>可能根本就没有任何想法。我们没有任何证据能证明这一点。

entry.key: ILEX: Why We Should Build A New Vessel
entry.value: ILEX: 为什么我们应该造一艘新母舰

entry.key: ILEX: Each Nomai clan explores the universe in its own Vessel. The Vessel is the heart of every clan.
entry.value: ILEX: 每个Nomai家族都乘坐他们的母舰来探索宇宙。母舰就是一个家族的核心。

entry.key: ILEX: It’s unusual for Nomai to remain in one place for so long. Nomai are wanderers and have no permanent home.
entry.value: ILEX: 对Nomai人来说一直留在一个地方是不正常的。Nomai人是漂泊种族而不需要固定的家。

entry.key: ILEX: If we built a new Vessel, we could return to our adventurous way of life. Imagine all the new places we could go! Our clan wouldn’t be stuck here in this star system.
entry.value: ILEX: 如果我们建造一艘新的母舰，我们就能回归我们冒险者的生活方式。想想我们能去往多少新地方！我们的家族也不会继续被困在这个太阳系里。

entry.key: ILEX: We could even meet with other Nomai, and learn from them, like Coleus says we used to do.
entry.value: ILEX: 我们甚至能和其他Nomai人见面，并向他们学习知识，就像Coleus说的我们以前做的那样。

entry.key: ILEX: It probably wouldn’t be hard to get parts if we stopped building other new things, and if we broke down other structures (like the towers on <color=lightblue>Ash Twin</color>) for parts.
entry.value: ILEX: 如果我们不再建造其他新的东西，或者拆解掉其他建筑(比如<color=lightblue>灰烬星</color>上的那些跃迁塔)，我们或许就能比较容易地获得建造母舰的组件。

entry.key: ILEX: We might have to build a smaller Vessel for now, even though Vessels are normally large. But we could make it bigger later once we reach planets with more resources.
entry.value: ILEX: 虽然通常来说母舰的尺寸很大，但我们可能只有先建造一艘较小的母舰。但只要当我们到达资源更多的行星后就可以将它造得更大一些。

entry.key: ILEX: It would also help if we stopped building so many things to search for the <color=lightblue>Eye of the universe</color>. I asked Yarrow, and he says we use lots of resources on the <color=orange>Ash Twin Project</color>.
entry.value: ILEX: 我们也可以停止建造这么多用来寻找<color=lightblue>宇宙之眼</color>的东西。我问过Yarrow，他说我们在建造<color=orange>灰烬星工程</color>上耗费了很多资源。

entry.key: ILEX: We could even have a warp core for jumping long distances like Vessels have. Poke tells me she plans to make a very advanced warp core for a different project. I’m sure she could connect it to the Vessel for travel (because Poke is smart).
entry.value: ILEX: 我们甚至也许能够造出一颗像母舰那样用来长距离跃迁的的跃迁核心。Poke告诉我她计划为另外一个工程制造一颗非常高级的跃迁核心。我相信她能够把它连接到母舰上用来航行（因为Poke很聪明）。

entry.key: THATCH: Is everyone unharmed?
entry.value: THATCH: 所有人都还好吗？

entry.key: PLUME: No one was badly injured from the <color=orange>escape pod’s</color> impact. We’re incredibly fortunate.
entry.value: PLUME: 我们很幸运，没有人因<color=orange>逃生舱</color>的撞击而严重受伤。

entry.key: THATCH: This is good news, at least. Have we heard from <color=orange>Escape Pod 2</color> or <color=orange>Escape Pod 3</color>?
entry.value: THATCH: 至少是个好消息。有没有收到来自<color=orange>二号逃生舱</color>或<color=orange>三号逃生舱</color>的消息？

entry.key: FILIX: No, I... I’m unable to make contact. My equipment can hear the other two escape pods’ distress signals, however. If it’s any comfort, both pods must be structurally intact.
entry.value: FILIX: 没有，我...我无法与他们通信。但我的设备能收到来自其他两个逃生舱的求救信号。至少，这意味着两个逃生舱都还结构完好。

entry.key: FILIX: I’ll continue calling for them.
entry.value: FILIX: 我会继续呼叫他们。

entry.key: THATCH: My gratitude. If we can —
entry.value: THATCH: 感谢。如果我们能——

entry.key: PLUME: Thatch, the moon is approaching again!
entry.value: PLUME: Thatch, 那卫星又靠近了！

entry.key: THATCH: Everyone brace yourselves, swiftly! The <color=lightblue>volcanic moon</color> has returned!
entry.value: THATCH: 所有人，迅速躲避！<color=lightblue>火山卫星</color>又来了！

entry.key: THATCH: Be cautious of falling ash and debris!
entry.value: THATCH: 小心落下的灰尘和碎石！

entry.key: PLUME: ...I believe the moon has passed.
entry.value: PLUME: ...我想卫星已经远离了。

entry.key: FILIX: This planet doesn’t appear eager to have guests. We are certainly unwelcome on its surface.
entry.value: FILIX: 这颗行星似乎对来客不太热情。它并不欢迎我们在地表上。

entry.key: THATCH: We need to find shelter, and quickly. The <color=lightblue>volcanic moon</color> won’t be gone for long.
entry.value: THATCH: 我们必须迅速的找到庇护处。<color=lightblue>火山卫星</color>很快就会回来。

entry.key: PLUME: I observed several promising sites below the surface, but we’ll need to construct a way for everyone to climb safely down this cliff. Perhaps we could build platforms?
entry.value: PLUME: 我在地表下探测到几个合适的位置，但我们需要建造一条路径以安全地爬下这个悬崖。也许我们应该建造栈道？

entry.key: CONOY: What have we learned thus far in our search for the <color=lightblue>Eye of the universe</color>?
entry.value: CONOY: 到目前为止，我们从<color=lightblue>宇宙之眼</color>的寻找任务中学到了什么?

entry.key: PLUME: Those of us on the <color=orange>Vessel</color> originally followed the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>’s signal to this star system, but we were unable to warp to the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> itself.
entry.value: PLUME: 我们中曾在<color=orange>母舰</color>上的人们原本是跟随着<color=lightblue>眼</color>的信号来到了这个太阳系，但我们却没能跃迁到<color=lightblue>眼</color>。

entry.key: PRIVET: The locator we built on the <color=lightblue>Attlerock</color> and the new, more sensitive locator we built here were both unable to detect any trace of the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>’s signal.
entry.value: PRIVET: 我们建造在<color=lightblue>废岩星k</color>上的定位器与这座更灵敏的新定位器都完全没有检测到<color=lightblue>眼</color>的信号。

entry.key: AVENS: Hypothesis: The <color=lightblue>Eye</color> has stopped emitting its signal.
entry.value: AVENS: 假设: <color=lightblue>眼</color>已经停止发出信号了

entry.key: CASSAVA: Suppose the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> doesn’t wish to be found.
entry.value: CASSAVA: 我认为<color=lightblue>眼</color>或许不愿被找到。

entry.key: PLUME: Cassava, how can you suggest that? The <color=lightblue>Eye</color>’s signal called out to summon us to this star system!
entry.value: PLUME: Cassava，你怎会这样想？是<color=lightblue>眼</color>的信号将我们召唤到这个太阳系的！

entry.key: CASSAVA: I’m aware; I grew up hearing the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>’s story. Yet we’re no closer to finding it than you were when you first arrived here.
entry.value: CASSAVA: 我当然知道，我是听着<color=lightblue>眼</color>的故事长大的。但我们却一点都没有比你们当初刚到这里时更接近找到它。

entry.key: MALLOW: Based on our knowledge of the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>, we believe the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> is in orbit around this star system’s <color=lightblue>sun</color>. This would mean the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> is located within a finite (albeit enormous) range.
entry.value: MALLOW: 基于我们对<color=lightblue>量子卫星</color>的了解，我们认为<color=lightblue>眼</color>位于环绕<color=lightblue>太阳</color>的某个轨道上。这意味着<color=lightblue>眼</color>位于一个有限（尽管极远）的距离之内。

entry.key: CONOY: How should our methods change as we continue our search for the <color=lightblue>Eye of the universe</color>?
entry.value: CONOY: 我们该如何改变继续寻找<color=lightblue>宇宙之眼</color>的方法呢？

entry.key: PRIVET: As we couldn’t find the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>’s signal using two different devices built for this exact purpose, we should discontinue this search method.
entry.value: PRIVET: 因为两个不同的信号定位设备都没有找到<color=lightblue>眼</color>的信号，我们应该停止这种寻找方式。

entry.key: MALLOW: We know what the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> looks like thanks to the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color>, so what if we try to find the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> visually, instead? Let’s send out a probe!
entry.value: MALLOW: 感谢<color=lightblue>量子卫星</color>让我们得以知道<color=lightblue>眼</color>的外观，那不如尝试用视觉直接寻找<color=lightblue>眼</color>，如何？我们就发射探测器吧！

entry.key: CASSAVA: Mallow’s idea is clever, but we have no idea where the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> is in relation to here. The probability of launching a probe in the correct direction would be absurdly small.
entry.value: CASSAVA: Mallow的提议不错，但我们完全不知道<color=lightblue>眼</color>相对于此处的位置。探测器的发射方向一次就正确的可能性小到离谱。

entry.key: CONOY: I believe I have a solution for that problem! Have you spoken with Ramie and Pye about the technology they’re developing?
entry.value: CONOY: 对于这个问题，我认为我们有解决方案！你有没有和Ramie和Pye谈过她们正在开发的技术呢？

entry.key: AVENS: We’d need to build a probe-launching mechanism to cover those long distances quickly. A cannon in orbit around a celestial body would circumvent the need to escape gravity’s pull.
entry.value: AVENS: 我们需要建造一个探测器发射机制来实现探测器的快速长距离飞行。一座位于环绕天体轨道的发射砲就能省去（从地表发射时）逃逸其引力造成的速度损耗。

entry.key: CASSAVA: <color=lightblue>Giant’s Deep</color> would be a good choice. It’s furthest from the <color=lightblue>sun</color>, so it would provide the best angles for launch. And it’s moonless (except when the <color=lightblue>Quantum Moon</color> is visiting).
entry.value: CASSAVA: <color=lightblue>深巨星</color>可能是个不错的选择。它离<color=lightblue>太阳</color>最远，所以能够提供最合适的发射角度。并且它没有卫星(除了<color=lightblue>量子卫星</color>出现时)。

entry.key: AVENS: Yes, let’s build the cannon in orbit around <color=lightblue>Giant’s Deep</color>!
entry.value: AVENS: 好，那我们就将发射砲建造在环绕<color=lightblue>深巨星</color>的轨道上吧！

entry.key: PLUME: The pain of your absence is sharp and haunting, and I would give anything not to know it; anything but never knowing you at all (which would be worse).
entry.value: PLUME: The pain of your absence is sharp and haunting, and I would give anything not to know it; anything but never knowing you at all (which would be worse).

entry.key: PLUME: I can only hope that you are safe, Keek, wherever you are.
entry.value: PLUME: I can only hope that you are safe, Keek, wherever you are.

entry.key: KOUSA: We can hear the other escape pods’ distress signals, which gives me hope. Foli, are you still here? I am unsure how to survive in this place without you.
entry.value: KOUSA: We can hear the other escape pods’ distress signals, which gives me hope. Foli, are you still here? I am unsure how to survive in this place without you.

entry.key: KOUSA: (I am unsure how to be me without you.)
entry.value: KOUSA: (I am unsure how to be me without you.)

entry.key: PLUME: My brother wasn’t in <color=orange>Escape Pod 1</color> with us. Was he in <color=orange>Pod 2</color>, or <color=orange>Pod 3</color>? Was he able to board an escape pod at all?
entry.value: PLUME: My brother wasn’t in <color=orange>Escape Pod 1</color> with us. Was he in <color=orange>Pod 2</color>, or <color=orange>Pod 3</color>? Was he able to board an escape pod at all?

entry.key: PLUME: We sacrificed too much arriving here. I cannot (I will not) allow our clan’s greatest loss to be in vain.
entry.value: PLUME: We sacrificed too much arriving here. I cannot (I will not) allow our clan’s greatest loss to be in vain.

entry.key: THATCH: Is the hardest part of this tragedy not knowing who we may have lost? Or will the hardest part come later, when we learn? (Be well, Aunt Melorae...)
entry.value: THATCH: Is the hardest part of this tragedy not knowing who we may have lost? Or will the hardest part come later, when we learn? (Be well, Aunt Melorae...)

entry.key: PLUME: Given concerns about our settlement’s stability, where should we construct a new, less temporary shelter?
entry.value: PLUME: Given concerns about our settlement’s stability, where should we construct a new, less temporary shelter?

entry.key: THATCH: We need to stay close to the <color=orange>escape pod</color> so Filix can monitor incoming messages. We can’t be rescued if we aren’t present to respond.
entry.value: THATCH: We need to stay close to the <color=orange>escape pod</color> so Filix can monitor incoming messages. We can’t be rescued if we aren’t present to respond.

entry.key: FILIX: I don’t believe anyone is coming to save us, Thatch. Now we must save ourselves.
entry.value: FILIX: I don’t believe anyone is coming to save us, Thatch. Now we must save ourselves.

entry.key: PLUME: I agree. We’re here because the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>’s signal called to us and we followed. If we’re to find it, we need to not merely survive, but thrive.
entry.value: PLUME: I agree. We’re here because the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>’s signal called to us and we followed. If we’re to find it, we need to not merely survive, but thrive.

entry.key: PLUME: I believe we should migrate to the northern glacier.
entry.value: PLUME: I believe we should migrate to the northern glacier.

entry.key: FILIX: What if we use gravity crystals to craft a stable path?
entry.value: FILIX: What if we use gravity crystals to craft a stable path?

entry.key: THATCH: Building beneath the crust again would shelter us from the <color=lightblue>volcanic moon</color>’s eruptions.
entry.value: THATCH: Building beneath the crust again would shelter us from the <color=lightblue>volcanic moon</color>’s eruptions.

entry.key: THATCH: This is a wise point, Plume, and eloquently made. If moving to the northern glacier will keep us safer, then that is what we should do.
entry.value: THATCH: This is a wise point, Plume, and eloquently made. If moving to the northern glacier will keep us safer, then that is what we should do.

entry.key: FILIX: Has anyone observed the <color=lightblue>phantom moon</color> that sometimes greets us in the night sky? Your thoughts interest me.
entry.value: FILIX: Has anyone observed the <color=lightblue>phantom moon</color> that sometimes greets us in the night sky? Your thoughts interest me.

entry.key: THATCH: I compliment your eyes! How do you imagine it disappears? Hypothesis: Could it be a shift in the light spectrum?
entry.value: THATCH: I compliment your eyes! How do you imagine it disappears? Hypothesis: Could it be a shift in the light spectrum?

entry.key: PLUME: Suppose this moon is too shy to show us its face.
entry.value: PLUME: Suppose this moon is too shy to show us its face.

entry.key: PLUME: I’m interested in your playful moon. Is it much like its violent friend (<color=lightblue>Hollow’s Lantern</color>)?
entry.value: PLUME: I’m interested in your playful moon. Is it much like its violent friend (<color=lightblue>Hollow’s Lantern</color>)?

entry.key: THATCH: Imagine if there were two volcanic moons.
entry.value: THATCH: Imagine if there were two volcanic moons.

entry.key: PLUME: Then I imagine there’d be none of us left!
entry.value: PLUME: Then I imagine there’d be none of us left!

entry.key: FILIX: Hypothesis: There can exist too much lava.
entry.value: FILIX: Hypothesis: There can exist too much lava.

entry.key: THATCH: I’d strongly prefer we test the null hypothesis.
entry.value: THATCH: I’d strongly prefer we test the null hypothesis.

entry.key: FILIX: This moon isn’t volcanic (to my unaided eyes). Sometimes it leaves its friend <color=lightblue>Hollow’s Lantern</color> for nights at a time.
entry.value: FILIX: This moon isn’t volcanic (to my unaided eyes). Sometimes it leaves its friend <color=lightblue>Hollow’s Lantern</color> for nights at a time.

entry.key: PLUME: The nights the moon circles this planet appear random. It seems to travel as it likes.
entry.value: PLUME: The nights the moon circles this planet appear random. It seems to travel as it likes.

entry.key: If the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> called to us, why won’t it reveal itself? Why is it so difficult to locate it?
entry.value: If the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> called to us, why won’t it reveal itself? Why is it so difficult to locate it?

entry.key: Did something happen to it?
entry.value: Did something happen to it?

entry.key: Did the signal stop? Does the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> no longer desire to be found?
entry.value: Did the signal stop? Does the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> no longer desire to be found?

entry.key: Perhaps this isn’t the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>’s choice. The <color=lightblue>Eye</color> may not be able to communicate with us more than it already has.
entry.value: Perhaps this isn’t the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>’s choice. The <color=lightblue>Eye</color> may not be able to communicate with us more than it already has.

entry.key: Did the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> deliberately call out to us by sending the signal, or did we hear the signal by coincidence?
entry.value: Did the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> deliberately call out to us by sending the signal, or did we hear the signal by coincidence?

entry.key: We could be seeing meaning where there is none. Suppose the signal was produced incidentally.
entry.value: We could be seeing meaning where there is none. Suppose the signal was produced incidentally.

entry.key: Does that mean the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> is any less important, though?
entry.value: Does that mean the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> is any less important, though?

entry.key: Perhaps the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> wanted to be found (could it be sentient?). Maybe it chose us.
entry.value: Perhaps the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> wanted to be found (could it be sentient?). Maybe it chose us.

entry.key: Does the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> desire something from us? Could it need us in some way?
entry.value: Does the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> desire something from us? Could it need us in some way?

entry.key: Maybe it doesn’t have to be us.
entry.value: Maybe it doesn’t have to be us.

entry.key: Is the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> natural, or artificial?
entry.value: Is the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> natural, or artificial?

entry.key: Maybe someone built it.
entry.value: Maybe someone built it.

entry.key: The <color=lightblue>Eye</color> is older than the universe itself. How could something exist before its creator?
entry.value: The <color=lightblue>Eye</color> is older than the universe itself. How could something exist before its creator?

entry.key: It could be naturally occurring, though this doesn’t answer how the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> could be as old as it is.
entry.value: It could be naturally occurring, though this doesn't answer how the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> could be as old as it is.

entry.key: Be welcomed in this place. This shrine is a space to reflect on what brought us to this star system: the signal from the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>. test
entry.value: Be welcomed in this place. This shrine is a space to reflect on what brought us to this star system: the signal from the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>.

entry.key: We observed the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>’s signal in our travels, and followed it here to find its source. test
entry.value: We observed the <color=lightblue>Eye</color>’s signal in our travels, and followed it here to find its source.

entry.key: What we know is this: The source of the signal (which we have chosen to call the <color=lightblue>Eye of the universe</color>) is older than this universe itself. The rest, we have yet to learn. test
entry.value: What we know is this: The source of the signal (which we have chosen to call the <color=lightblue>Eye of the universe</color>) is older than this universe itself. The rest, we have yet to learn.

entry.key: Enter, and open your mind to its possibilities. test
entry.value: Enter, and open your mind to its possibilities.

entry.key: SOLANUM: I don’t know why everyone says the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> is important.
entry.value: SOLANUM: I don’t know why everyone says the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> is important.

entry.key: SOLANUM: They say it brought us to this solar system, but is that good? Dad told me lots of Nomai died when our clan came here.
entry.value: SOLANUM: They say it brought us to this solar system, but is that good? Dad told me lots of Nomai died when our clan came here.

entry.key: SOLANUM: What if the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> wanted that to happen?
entry.value: SOLANUM: What if the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> wanted that to happen?

entry.key: SOLANUM: What if the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> isn’t something good?
entry.value: SOLANUM: What if the <color=lightblue>Eye</color> isn’t something good?

entry.key: 1: <color=orange>High Energy Lab</color> Trailhead
entry.value: 1：高能实验室路径入口

entry.key: 2: <color=orange>Stepping Stone District</color>
entry.value: 2：踏脚石区

entry.key: 3: <color=orange>Anglerfish Overlook District</color>
entry.value: 3：鮟鱇鱼望台区

entry.key: 4: <color=orange>Eye Shrine District</color>
entry.value: 4：眼圣堂区

entry.key: ANNONA: We need status reports for all systems, but initial things first: Is everyone unharmed?
entry.value: ANNONA: We need status reports for all systems, but initial things first: Is everyone unharmed?

entry.key: RHUS: Our color=orange>escape pod</color>’s passengers are afraid, but physically well, Annona; everyone survived the crash.
entry.value: RHUS: Our <color=orange>escape pod</color>’s passengers are afraid, but physically well, Annona; everyone survived the crash.

entry.key: ANNONA: This is a relief, at least. You have my gratitude. Bur, were you able to find the other escape pods’ distress signals?
entry.value: ANNONA: This is a relief, at least. You have my gratitude. Bur, were you able to find the other escape pods’ distress signals?

entry.key: BUR: I can hear both signals somewhere in this star system, but I don’t believe either escape pod crashed on the same planet as us.
entry.value: BUR: I can hear both signals somewhere in this star system, but I don’t believe either escape pod crashed on the same planet as us.

entry.key: BEGIN FLIGHTLOG: <color=orange>Escape Pod 2</color>. <color=orange>Vessel</color> has been mortally injured. Emergency sequence activated. Awaiting departure from <color=orange>Vessel</color>.
entry.value: BEGIN FLIGHTLOG: <color=orange>Escape Pod 2</color>. <color=orange>Vessel</color> has been mortally injured. Emergency sequence activated. Awaiting departure from <color=orange>Vessel</color>.

entry.key: Launching <color=orange>Escape Pod 3</color>... Now launching <color=orange>Escape Pod 2</color>.
entry.value: Launching <color=orange>Escape Pod 3</color>... Now launching <color=orange>Escape Pod 2</color>.

entry.key: Scanning external environment... Scan complete. External temperature is prohibitively high. Verdict: INHOSPITABLE. Do not seek shelter on planet surface.
entry.value: Scanning external environment... Scan complete. External temperature is prohibitively high. Verdict: INHOSPITABLE. Do not seek shelter on planet surface.

entry.key: MELORAE: This is amazing (look inside the cave)! How did this come to rest here? We haven’t encountered others in these caves; I think this is a rare find.
entry.value: MELORAE: This is amazing (look inside the cave)! How did this come to rest here? We haven’t encountered others in these caves; I think this is a rare find.

entry.key: MELORAE: From what we can see, Coleus and I believe the specimen must be very old indeed. Imagine what we might learn if we could examine it!
entry.value: MELORAE: From what we can see, Coleus and I believe the specimen must be very old indeed. Imagine what we might learn if we could examine it!

entry.key: COLEUS: An update: We need to find a way inside quickly, Melorae, because when I returned here to search for an entrance to the cave, there were children playing on the specimen!
entry.value: COLEUS: An update: We need to find a way inside quickly, Melorae, because when I returned here to search for an entrance to the cave, there were children playing on the specimen!

entry.key: COLEUS: We both agree it’s unlikely this dry planet is this horror’s place of origin (especially considering what we observed during the <color=orange>Vessel</color>’s evacuation).
entry.value: COLEUS: We both agree it’s unlikely this dry planet is this horror’s place of origin (especially considering what we observed during the <color=orange>Vessel</color>’s evacuation).

entry.key: MELORAE: Clearly this hole is too small for it to have fit through. Hypothesis: There is another entrance to this cave. If there is, Coleus and I will find it! We can’t leave valuable information undiscovered!
entry.value: MELORAE: Clearly this hole is too small for it to have fit through. Hypothesis: There is another entrance to this cave. If there is, Coleus and I will find it! We can’t leave valuable information undiscovered!

entry.key: MELORAE: We have found an enormous cavern at the end of this passage that appears promising! I believe we could construct long-term shelter there.
entry.value: MELORAE: We have found an enormous cavern at the end of this passage that appears promising! I believe we could construct long-term shelter there.

entry.key: ANNONA: The cavern Melorae found is a wise choice for shelter. Could one of you mark directions for the others to follow?
entry.value: ANNONA: The cavern Melorae found is a wise choice for shelter. Could one of you mark directions for the others to follow?

entry.key: COLEUS: This is the start of the path to the shelter site. I’ve left directions to guide you there.
entry.value: COLEUS: This is the start of the path to the shelter site. I've left directions to guide you there.

entry.key: MELORAE: Of note: We must hurry, as the pathway there is filling with sand. Do not allow yourself to be buried by sand, and make sure no one is lost!
entry.value: MELORAE: Of note: We must hurry, as the pathway there is filling with sand. Do not allow yourself to be buried by sand, and make sure no one is lost!

entry.key: MELORAE: Anglerfish study
entry.value: MELORAE：对鮟鱇鱼的研究记录

entry.key: COLEUS: An update: Melorae, while I was here making sketches of the anglerfish, I observed the children I saw earlier playing here again. They’ve added a rule to their game that incorporates our research (it’s wonderful)!
entry.value: COLEUS: An update: Melorae, while I was here making sketches of the anglerfish, I observed the children I saw earlier playing here again. They’ve added a rule to their game that incorporates our research (it’s wonderful)!

entry.key: MELORAE: I’m entirely delighted! It’s never too early to appreciate biology!
entry.value: MELORAE: I’m entirely delighted! It’s never too early to appreciate biology!

entry.key: COLEUS: This anglerfish’s digestive tract suggests death by starvation.
entry.value: COLEUS: This anglerfish’s digestive tract suggests death by starvation.

entry.key: MELORAE: Visually, the specimen appears to be of the same species as the anglerfish in <color=lightblue>Dark Bramble</color>. We don’t believe it originated from this planet.
entry.value: MELORAE: Visually, the specimen appears to be of the same species as the anglerfish in <color=lightblue>Dark Bramble</color>. We don’t believe it originated from this planet.

entry.key: MELORAE: The long growth protruding from its head is bioluminescent. Perhaps it used this growth to attract prey (a lure?).
entry.value: MELORAE: The long growth protruding from its head is bioluminescent. Perhaps it used this growth to attract prey (a lure?).

entry.key: LAEVI: Whoever was it when we ended last time is the anglerfish.
entry.value: LAEVI: Whoever was it when we ended last time is the anglerfish.

entry.key: LAEVI: Rule change! The anglerfish now has to wear a blindfold. (And do not peek!)
entry.value: LAEVI: Rule change! The anglerfish now has to wear a blindfold. (And do not peek!)

entry.key: LAEVI: The rest of us (the littlefish) line up against one wall. When the anglerfish says go, the littlefish sneak across to the other side.
entry.value: LAEVI: The rest of us (the littlefish) line up against one wall. When the anglerfish says go, the littlefish sneak across to the other side.

entry.key: LAEVI: If the anglerfish catches you, you’re eaten.
entry.value: LAEVI: If the anglerfish catches you, you’re eaten.

entry.key: LAEVI: Last littlefish to be caught is the new anglerfish! (The old anglerfish gives the new anglerfish the blindfold and becomes a littlefish.)
entry.value: LAEVI: Last littlefish to be caught is the new anglerfish! (The old anglerfish gives the new anglerfish the blindfold and becomes a littlefish.)

entry.key: LAMI: Why are we changing it? It’s too hard if you can’t see anything!
entry.value: LAMI: Why are we changing it? It’s too hard if you can’t see anything!

entry.key: LAEVI: Aunt Pye says real anglerfish are blind, so you have to wear a blindfold! The rule stands!
entry.value: LAEVI: Aunt Pye says real anglerfish are blind, so you have to wear a blindfold! The rule stands!

entry.key: ILEX: Rule update: It’s okay if younger kids don’t wear the blindfold when they’re it. (The rest of us will still wear it for scientific accuracy and to make the game more even.)
entry.value: ILEX: Rule update: It’s okay if younger kids don’t wear the blindfold when they’re it. (The rest of us will still wear it for scientific accuracy and to make the game more even.)

entry.key: MELORAE: This planet sometimes (and only sometimes) has a moon! This is also of note: It disappears if no one is watching it! Isn’t that a fascinating orbital characteristic?
entry.value: MELORAE: This planet sometimes (and only sometimes) has a moon! This is also of note: It disappears if no one is watching it! Isn’t that a fascinating orbital characteristic?

entry.key: BUR: I found your note, Melorae; kindly count me among this <color=lightblue>moon</color>’s admirers! What is happening when it disappears (I doubt it ceases to exist)? Does it move to another location?
entry.value: BUR: I found your note, Melorae; kindly count me among this <color=lightblue>moon</color>’s admirers! What is happening when it disappears (I doubt it ceases to exist)? Does it move to another location?

entry.key: ANNONA: I believe so. Not only does the moon appear around <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color>, I can confirm it sometimes orbits <color=lightblue>Timber Hearth</color>, as well.
entry.value: ANNONA: I believe so. Not only does the moon appear around <color=lightblue>Brittle Hollow</color>, I can confirm it sometimes orbits <color=lightblue>Timber Hearth</color>, as well.

entry.key: MELORAE: This is my first time encountering a natural satellite with the ability to vanish when not being watched. We should study it! Or, even better, we should travel there!
entry.value: MELORAE: This is my first time encountering a natural satellite with the ability to vanish when not being watched. We should study it! Or, even better, we should travel there!

entry.key: BUR: I agree! Our first step would be determining a method to track this <color=lightblue>phantom moon</color> so that we can always know where it is.
entry.value: BUR: I agree! Our first step would be determining a method to track this <color=lightblue>phantom moon</color> so that we can always know where it is.

entry.key: ANNONA: Given its reluctance to move while consciously observed, it might be a form of macroscopic quantum mechanics.
entry.value: ANNONA: Given its reluctance to move while consciously observed, it might be a form of macroscopic quantum mechanics.

entry.key: COLEUS: How curious! This rock took me with it to a new location. I wonder why this happened?
entry.value: COLEUS: How curious! This rock took me with it to a new location. I wonder why this happened?

entry.key: COLEUS: Curious, but also alarming: This new cave appears to lack an entrance or exit. Also, the rock that brought me here disappeared while I wasn’t watching.
entry.value: COLEUS: Curious, but also alarming: This new cave appears to lack an entrance or exit. Also, the rock that brought me here disappeared while I wasn’t watching.

entry.key: COLEUS: The wandering rock has returned! Never before have I been so delighted to see a sedimentary specimen.
entry.value: COLEUS: The wandering rock has returned! Never before have I been so delighted to see a sedimentary specimen.

entry.key: COLEUS: I wonder if I myself became quantum briefly when the rock carried me here! This seems the clearest explanation. Hypothesis: If the rock can bring me here, it can also carry me out.
entry.value: COLEUS: I wonder if I myself became quantum briefly when the rock carried me here! This seems the clearest explanation. Hypothesis: If the rock can bring me here, it can also carry me out.

entry.key: COLEUS: My hypothesis was correct! I can travel on this rock, as long as I’m not observing my surroundings (meaning I must be in complete darkness). I’m going to bring my mentor here to see this.
entry.value: COLEUS: My hypothesis was correct! I can travel on this rock, as long as I’m not observing my surroundings (meaning I must be in complete darkness). I’m going to bring my mentor here to see this.

entry.key: COLEUS: Melorae is here now, too. We theorize when a conscious being is in contact with a quantum object and ceases to observe his or her surroundings, the being can become entangled with that quantum object, and they move together.
entry.value: COLEUS: Melorae is here now, too. We theorize when a conscious being is in contact with a quantum object and ceases to act as an observer (explaining the need for darkness), the being can become entangled with that quantum object, and they move together.

entry.key: MELORAE: Friends, Coleus has discovered a new quantum rule! (He has also promised me he’ll never vanish again, even if he does learn something useful from it!)
entry.value: MELORAE: Friends, Coleus has discovered a new quantum rule! (He has also promised me he’ll never vanish again, even if he does learn something useful from it!)

entry.key: MELORAE: Coleus is missing! He vanished from the <color=orange>Lakebed Cave</color> (the one at the bottom of the dry lakebed at the north pole) several days ago, and we’re unable to find any trace of him. I don’t know how much air he had when he disappeared. I beg any friend reading this, help us recover Coleus!
entry.value: MELORAE: Coleus is missing! He vanished from the <color=orange>Lakebed Cave</color> (the one at the bottom of the dry lakebed at the north pole) several days ago, and we’re unable to find any trace of him. I don’t know how much air he had when he disappeared. I beg any friend reading this, help us recover Coleus!
